jobDetails:
FamilyAid Boston, the citys largest human service agency solely focused on ending childhood and family homelessness, is seeking a Bilingual (Spanish) Licensed/MSW Social Worker to stabilize families experiencing homelessness.

Reporting to the Prevention and Diversion Program Manager, the Bilingual Social Worker will support parents and children with housing stability in health care and educational and social service settings. The Social Worker will provide families with comprehensive case management including pre-tenancy and tenancy preservation support services through coordinating both services and financial assistance. The worker will ensure 100% housing retention and long-term stability for participating children and their parents.

The successful candidate will have a MSW or social work license (LPC, LMHC, LCSW, LISCSW), be fluent in Spanish, more than three years of successful experience in social services, including work in clinical settings, with family and crisis interventions, with children experiencing significant emotional/behavioral challenges, and with housing navigation. The successful candidate will demonstrate success in applying evidence-based practices including trauma-informed care, critical time intervention and motivational interviewing. Experience in homelessness prevention and diversion programming is desired. A valid drivers license and the ability to operate a vehicle safely is required.

FamilyAid Boston is dynamic, friendly, and diverse where results, professional growth and work/life balance are valued. We offer competitive salaries, contribute to employees health, dental and retirement plans, and provide generous paid time off. The agency is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, disability, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age.

Interested applicants should send a cover letter and resume. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Summary

 This position is in the Region 1, Mission Support Division, Grants Management Branch. If selected, you must work at the location stated in this announcement. About EPA Region 1: EPA Region 1 (New England)Learn more about this agency

Responsibilities

 You will:

- Serve as a technical and programmatic liaison in providing assistance, training, and cross-divisional support to Region 1 Grant Project Officers;

- Design and create regional and/or Division-specific Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for key aspects of Project Officer Grants management;

- Conduct assessment of grants management challenges encountered by Region 1 tribal grantees and identify opportunities to provide training, tools, and technical assistance;

- Coordinate with internal stakeholders and work with the Region’s IT Branch to develop a sustainable web-based system for managing grants information;

- Manage special projects and lead ad hoc teams.

When entering a Federal job at a grade level lower than the highest promotion potential level, you may be promoted to more complex duties and work more independently as your career progresses.

 Requirements

 Requirements

  Conditions of Employment




 If you are selected, a pre-employment background check is required.
You must submit a resume and required documents--see How to Apply section.
This is a temporary position (see Other Information on assignment limits).

This position is designated as Moderate Risk and requires a background investigation. Unless an appropriate background investigation is already on record with the Office of Personnel Management, you must undergo a background investigation.

You must meet time in grade requirements no later than 30 calendar days after the closing date of this announcement.

 Qualifications

 You do not need a degree to qualify for this position.

We are looking for at least one year of specialized experience related to this position as described below:

To qualify for the GS-12 level, you need to have at least one year of full-time experience equivalent to the GS-11 level defined as developing and applying analytical approaches, methodology, concepts and techniques to plan and carry out studies/projects to assist the organization in program planning, measurement, and/or progress evaluation; and making presentations to various audiences.

To qualify for the GS-13 level, you need to have at least one year of full-time experience equivalent to the GS-12 level defined as designing and conducting comprehensive management studies to identify and propose solutions to complex or controversial management problems with far-reaching scope or impact to a broad range of program operations; and assisting with educational outreach and/or training in a professional setting.

Your answers to the online assessment will be used to evaluate your competencies in the following areas: 1) Knowledge of policies, regulations, and fiscal procedures relating to federal grants management; 2) Ability provide training to various audiences; 3) Skill in project management; 4) Skill in written communication; 5) Skill in performing quantitative and qualitative analyses; 6) Ability to coordinate projects across multiple organizations; 7) Skill in planning, organizing, and/or directing teams; 8) Skill in oral communication.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

If you have part-time work experience, read this: EPA Announcement Policies and Procedures.

Position has portable work and selectee may be authorized to telework after meeting eligibility requirements if approved by the supervisor/manager.

If you are selected, travel, transportation, and relocation expenses will not be paid by EPA. Any travel, transportation, and relocation expenses associated with reporting to work in this position will be your responsibility.

If you are selected, you will serve in either a temporary promotion or a detail.

If this position is at a higher grade than your current grade, the assignment will be a temporary promotion which will be processed for a period not to exceed one year. It may be extended up to four additional years without further competition, for a total of five years.

If you are already at the same grade as this position, your assignment will be a detail which will be processed for a period not to exceed 120 days, and may be extended in 120 day increments. While on the detail, your salary will not change.

You may be returned at any time to the position from which you were temporarily promoted or detailed, or to a different position of equivalent position and pay.

This position is in the bargaining unit.Read more


 How You Will Be Evaluated

 You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.

We will review your resume and required documents to ensure you meet the basic qualification requirements. Your resume must address the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed in the Qualifications section. If you meet basic qualification requirements, your application will be further evaluated based on your answers to the online assessment. Your responses to the online assessment will be used to measure the degree to which your background matches the requirements for the position and an applicable score assigned.

We will compare your resume and supporting documentation to your responses on the assessment questionnaire. If you rate yourself higher than is supported by your application materials, your responses may be adjusted and/or you may be excluded from consideration for this job. We will evaluate your qualifications and eligibility and notify you if you meet minimum qualification requirements. If you are referred for consideration, you may be subject to additional assessments.

COVID -19 Social Compliance Officer - Military Experience

About Us: 

Metro One is the nation’s premier Loss Prevention and Security Organization, with more than 100 National Clients and 3,000 security personnel. Our employees are largely security officers, unarmed and armed, concierge officers, special event security, and trained and licensed personnel who work in retail, logistics, corporate, education and other industries and settings. Importantly, we are a Living Wage Employer, which elevated our wage and bill levels, and demands that we deliver.

Social Compliance Officer Summary: 

Conducts access control assessments of employee, visitor and or customer at entry points in work environments to determine if compliance, life safety and health requirements are being met. Has familiarity with, security controls, life safety, health screening concepts, customer service and social distancing practices, and procedures. Performs a variety of tasks related to access control screening, health screening, visitor/vendor access and life safety inspections. Works under general supervision; typically reports to a supervisor or manager. Provide assistance to customers, employees and visitors in a courteous and professional manner.

Organizational Overview

About Fresh is a Boston area nonprofit on a mission to strengthen communities by getting healthy food to the households that need it most. Our programs are built to be integrated into community healthcare systems and are designed to scale with our partnerships and emerging opportunities.

Programs:


Fresh Truck mobile markets bring affordable, healthy food to low-income neighborhoods throughout Boston.
Fresh Connect is a digital payment platform that enables health care providers to subsidize the cost of healthy food for patients and analyze the health-related impacts of improved diets.
Fresh Box - Door-to-door food distribution program developed in response to the COVID-19 crisis.

Job Description

Market Managers are the face of Fresh Truck in our communities, they make the shopping experience for our customers delightful and unique. This role requires a diverse skill as well as a passion for community building and food. We are hiring an additional Market Manager to support our COVID-19 response efforts including managing Fresh Box deliveries.

What you'll do:


Drive a full-size, 39ft school bus
Create an inviting shopping experience through engaging customer service
Manage market support staff, youth employees, and volunteers
Load fresh produce in and out of the mobile markets at the beginnings and ends of shifts
Support other Fresh Truck initiatives such as customer surveys and operations process improvement
Drive Fresh Box delivery routes ensuring households get the food they need

Who you are:


An excellent driver, accustomed to driving in an urban environment; strong preference for individuals with experience driving box trucks and large vehicles
You're willing to get your hands dirty, comfortable with some heavy lifting and will stop at nothing to make things happen
Embrace working within diverse community settings and with a strong sense of social justice; being multilingual (Spanish, Haitian Creole, Portuguese, Cantonese, Mandarin) is huge a plus

Requirements


Driver's license with clean driving record for the past 3 years
Ability to lift ~50lb on a regular basis
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Work collaboratively with the team of Market Managers

Compensation and Benefits


Competitive, experience-based salary starting at $45,000
Full medical, dental, and vision insurance
Free groceries every shift

Job Posting Description

At Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. In major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed team and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

The Operations Assistant will be responsible for:


Serving as a liaison to for the Emergency Department to resolve equipment, supply, safety, compliance, operational, and cleaning issues.Regulatory, Safety, and Compliance:


Participating in daily safety huddles to address safety and regulatory compliance.Visually monitoring environment for compliance with regulatory agencies, including JCAHO to include the following:


Equipment checksFire and life safetyMonitoring of compressed gas cylinders
Participating in Engineering/Safety/ESD rounds. Maintaining compliance with safety requirements. Arranging annual safety inspections of electrical equipment. Working with Safety personnel to ensure proper storage of supplies and equipment.Conducting weekly audits, including


Eye wash station, etc.Organization of all storage areas/rooms, elevator landing and emergency equipment.



Equipment Management:


Interfacing with staff continuously throughout the day related to equipment needs and quickly problem solving issues.Maintaining equipment and furniture inventory for areas and monitoring to ensure all equipment and furniture are in good working order.Maintaining an accurate list of medical equipment to include information such as serial number, date of purchase, repair history, etc.Collaborating with Health Technology Management to resolve medical equipment issues.Conducting inventory of equipment and notifying supervisor of missing items. Identifying and tagging items in need of repair and develops tracking system to ensure return to area.Bringing all unresolved equipment issues to the attention of the Administrator/Coordinator.Ensuring all equipment is cleaned in a timely manner.Stocking and organizing supplies in assigned areas, such as patient rooms and anything non ParEx.
Administrative and Patient Experience Rep


Answering, screening and routing telephone calls. Responding to requests for routine information or assistance within scope of knowledge and authority.Greeting and directing patients, families and visitors. Monitoring daily schedule and patient flow to optimize resource utilization and patient experience. Communicating with clinicians and/or supervisor and routes patients/visitors to maintain efficient patient/visitor flow.Communicating with other departments to coordinate ancillary clinical/administrative services.Performing routine administrative duties, such as opening and sorting mail, photocopying materials and sorting, collating and distributing documents.Organizing and scheduling conferences, seminars and other department sponsored programs or events. Organizing documents and/or presentations and logistics for meetings, presentations and events.


To qualify, you must have:


High School degree or equivalent1 year customer service, administrative, or experience in a health care setting.


Boston Children’s Hospital offers competitive compensation and unmatched benefits, including a flexible schedule, affordable health, vision and dental insurance, generous levels of time off, 403(b) Retirement Savings plan, Pension, Tuition Reimbursement, and discounted rates on T-passes. Discover your best.

StudyPoint’s mission is to help kids succeed in school. We’re a growing ed-tech company and a leader in the online and face-to-face tutoring space.

While we think we have a great story to tell on multiple fronts, we’ve done very little PR throughout our 20-year history. We’d like to change that, and as a result we’re seeking someone to help us develop and pitch several storylines to local and national media outlets.

If you’ve built a great public relations skill set, can manage multiple key initiatives independently, are a creative problem solver, and take pride in deploying high quality marketing efforts, then we encourage you to learn more about joining our team.

Responsibilities

Help develop and craft the narrative and strategy for our outreach.Build campaign materials and media contact lists.Distribute and pitch company storylines across local and national media outlets.Coach senior leadership team on media engagements and interviews.Work with members of our marketing team and our CEO to integrate and align on brand messaging.In addition to the above core responsibilities, you’ll have the opportunity to wear multiple marketing hats and contribute on projects as we look to continue innovating on the marketing front.

Qualifications

A strong intellect (and a Bachelor’s Degree).4+ years of public relations experience.Excellent written communication skills and strong pitching skills.An exceptional work ethic and meticulous attention to detail.A passion for marketing and helping kids.Ability to react and adjust to shifting priorities.

Benefits

This will be a full-time position, though it will start out as a temporary role with the potential to become permanent.Work from home.The opportunity to work side by side with senior leadership to shape marketing strategies and campaigns.A tremendous opportunity for learning and growth: you'll be a key player on campaigns that affect the entire organization's success. (You'll never find that level of responsibility and exposure in a large company.)A fun and supportive team that is as intelligent, as driven, and as passionate about their work as you are.The certainty that the work you do contributes to the educational success of students across the country, and soon -- the globe.

StudyPoint’s mission is to help kids succeed in school. We’re a growing ed-tech company and a leader in the online and face-to-face tutoring space.

While we’ve built out advanced capabilities in several marketing channels, we’ve done very little in paid social. We know it should be a successful channel for us, but we’ve never made the investment needed to get it off the ground. We’re looking to change that, and as a result we’re seeking someone to help us develop and implement best practices – with the goal of getting this channel to a sustainable ROI.

If you have solid experience in paid social media, can manage multiple key initiatives independently, are a creative problem solver, and take pride in deploying high quality marketing efforts, then we encourage you to learn more about joining our team.

Responsibilities

jobDetails:

ACCOUNTABILITIES:

EXPERIENCE:

Ability to analyze process flows to identify gaps, risks and impediments and implement effective corrective action to increase efficiency and/or improve compliance. Work is checked only to the effectiveness of results obtained, typically requiring a long-term perspective.Operates effectively in a team setting as a leader, facilitator and team member.Strong communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.

Like all Skilled Nursing Facilities in Massachusetts, we too have been stricken by Covid-19. But because we only hire SUPER HEROES we have been very successful in containing the spread, and have had our full house of Residents and Employees tested twice. Until further notice EVERY employee at Sancta Maria has received a 50% PAYRAISE - and is being paid DOUBLE their rate of pay for picking up an emergency shift within the next 72 hours. ONLY Super Heroes deserve that and ONLY Sancta Maria has provided it!! We take care of our employees!!!!Job Summary: Administers nursing care to residents as directed by physicians' orders and in accordance with Sancta Maria’s established policies, procedures, philosophy, objectives, and standards of nursing care and practice. An exciting opportunities for RN's/LPN's to make a difference by providing quality care in our mission driven, not-for-profit skilled nursing facility. Full-time, part-time and per diem shifts available.
Requirements: Current Mass. license required. Minimum 1 year experience in a long-term care/short term rehab setting preferred.  Job Details: 
The following duties are not intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification. Shown are duties intended to provide a summary of the major duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties.

Evaluates residents and provides direct nursing care as prescribed by physicians orders and multidisciplinary care plan to include

Medication administration
Treatments and dressings
Enteral feedings and feeding tube changes/insertions
Intravenous therapy and IV medications to be mixed on-site.
Indwelling catheter insertions, changes, irrigations
Oxygen therapy.
Supportive respiratory therapy(suction/trach care).
Colostomy/Ileostomy care, vaginal douches, enemas, etc.
Care/approach for age appropriate/age specific behaviors, disease specific behaviors
Emergency care
Resident death pronouncements with physician’s order.


Develops written resident care plan based on nursing assessment which identifies individualized resident needs, interventions and care goals.
Receives report from outgoing nurse and provides report to incoming nursing staff before leaving duty.
Makes rounds when arriving for duty and throughout shift to observe condition of resident and conveys any pertinent information to staff and others involved the resident’s care.
At start of shift, counts controlled substances, secures keys and assumes responsibility for assigned med cart with nurse from prior shift. At end of shift, counts off controlled substances and passes keys with incoming nurse. Ensures all medications are stored, counted and locked. Orders and destroys medications in accordance with policy and procedure.
Notifies Nurse Manager/Shift Supervisor of a resident’s change in condition, transfer to hospital, deaths, any incidents, accidents, abnormal lab results, and performs any follow-up such as arranging for transfer to hospital, notifying physician, family, etc. .
At start of shift, checks nursing assistant assignment sheet to ensure CNA’s understand their specific resident assignments, any changes in care, special circumstances, breaks and meal times.
Supervises work of nursing assistants to ensure tasks and duties are carried out as directed and assists as necessary to ensure residents are safe, clean, comfortable, bathed, washed, changed, groomed, clothed appropriately, positioned properly, meals and feeding is accomplished, call lights are answered in a timely manner, and any other required care is provided. Checks CNA documentation for accuracy and completion including weights, intake/output, positioning, bath, meal intake recording, etc.
Documents resident care in accordance with Facility and nursing department policies and procedures. Charts each shift, completes nursing summary for each resident on a monthly basis,
Communicates, collaborates, and cooperates with staff from other departments for coordination of resident care.
Understands and follows existing lines of communication and authority.
Understands and follows established procedures for resident/family/staff complaints.
Recognizes and assesses for signs and symptoms of abuse, understands mechanism, mandates and time-lines for reporting abuse.


Follows all safety, security, sanitation, hazardous material and infection control policies and procedures and monitors compliance by other staff members.
Reports any unsafe conditions, equipment problems to maintenance/housekeeping for resolution.
Maintains nursing supplies, anticipates needed supplies and uses supplies as needed to accomplish job results.
Attends and encourages staff to attend educational programs. Participates in staff meetings and provides constructive input. Maintains professional and technical knowledge as required by license.
Participates and encourages quality improvement ideas and programs
Maintains confidentiality of all resident information. Ensures residents’ rights and privacy are protected at all times.
Assists in orientation and training of staff.
Maintains cooperative relationship with health care team by communicating information, responding to requests, building rapport and participates in team building and team problem solving methods.
Adheres to Sancta Maria’s Organizational Integrity Program, Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest policies.
Demonstrates, promotes and monitors excellent customer care.

Sancta Maria offers an excellent salary and benefit package and is conveniently located on the Cambridge/Belmont line. Free on-site parking; accessible by public transportation. Your Health Insurance plan premiums are paid 75% by Sancta Maria AND we have a Health Savings Account that pays up to $3,000 of your deductibles. Our employees love our health insurance plans and tell us that no other Nursing Faclity can compete!!Company DescriptionThe Sancta Maria is a small, independent, non-profit skilled nursing facility that believes teamwork is the recipe for success. We have successfully surrounded ourselves with incredible employees who embrace their responsibilities, demonstrate compassion for our Residents and Patients, and who enjoy and appreciate their colleagues. If working in a "family oriented" environment appeals to you, then we hope that you will forward along your resume, and wish you good luck during the interview process.

We take care of our employees!!!!Job Summary: Under the direction of a Registered Nurse or Licensed Practical Nurse and in accordance with established policies and procedures assists residents with activities of daily living. Sancta Maria is currently looking for nursing assistants who are passionate about providing quality care and making a difference in the lives of our long and short term/rehab residents. As part of the nursing team, you will be responsible for assisting residents with activities of daily living to include bathing, feeding, dressing, engaging, encouraging and recognizing the needs of our residents. Full time, Part-time and Per Diem positions available on all shifts. Requirements: Current Mass. certification required. Experience in long term/rehab setting helpful. Job Details:
The following duties are not intended to serve as a comprehensive list of all duties performed by all employees in this classification. Shown are duties intended to provide a summary of the major duties and responsibilities. Incumbent(s) may be required to perform all duties listed and may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties.
Performs all resident care and tasks as assigned and according to established policies and procedures

Provides personal care and assists residents with activities of daily living, including but not limited to

Oral hygiene to include setting up and performing denture care, brushing teeth, flossing teeth.
Bathing providing bed bath, shower, or tub bath maintaining resident privacy.
Dressing, undressing and providing appropriate footwear.
Grooming to include shaving, washing, brushing/combing hair, nail care, assisting with make-up application.
Elimination needs to include toileting by offering bedpan, urinal, assisting on/off toilet maintaining privacy and dignity, supervises toileting, if required.
Incontinence care to include changing residents when wet/soiled, maintaining cleanliness of resident after elimination.
Collects specimens such as urine, stool, sputum as required.
Nutrition and hydration to include serving/setting-up resident meals, checking for correct diet, feeding residents if necessary, monitoring for chewing, choking, swallowing issues, motivates and encourages intake of nourishment and fluids, provides fluids as necessary or as requested.
Mobility to include transferring, ambulating, transporting residents using assistive devices such as walker, cane, wheelchair, mechanical lifting equipment, lift sheets, gait belts, etc.
Restorative nursing care to include range of motion, positioning/repositioning, preventive skin care, reinforcement through teaching ADL independence and provides assistance with exercise and activities.
Engagement by including residents in activities according to their interests to ensure appropriate stimulation and interactions.
Transports residents to meals, activities or other events as scheduled or requested.
Makes resident’s bed, changes linens and immediately transports soiled linen cart to laundry holding room in accordance with infection control guidelines.
Evacuates residents in an emergency according to policy and procedures.




Reviews written resident care plan/card at the beginning of each shift or as necessary before providing care to ensure full understanding of resident care needs or requirements; If unsure, asks nurse for clarification before provision of care.
Obtains assignment at start of shift listening to instructions or guidance from charge nurse regarding individual resident’s needs/condition.
Gathers and records electronically in electronic medical record(EMR) or on appropriate forms/logs, information such as activities of daily living, vital signs, weight, height, intake/output, meal and nourishment percentages or other assigned documentation as required.
Answers call-lights in a prompt and helpful manner.
Makes continuous rounds to monitor resident for safety and care needs.
Carries out nursing care routines to prevent skin breakdown, contracture and immobility and to keep residents clean, dry, comfortable, safe and secure.
Observes resident’s physical and mental condition, including behavior, mood, vital signs, weight, skin condition, mobility status, appetite, activity level, level of independence in ADL and progress toward care plan goals and reports observations or changes accurately and in a timely manner.
Communicates with appropriate staff regarding all aspects of resident care and seeks assistance as necessary.
Maintains resident rooms, personal belongings and property in neat, safe and secure manner.
Uses all required safety devices, personal protective equipment and standard precautions as required.
Adheres to all infection control and safety policies and procedures.
Works and interacts tactfully and cooperatively with all residents, family members and staff.
Adheres to Sancta Maria’s Organizational Integrity program, Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest policies


Understands and upholds Residents Rights and HIPAA rules/regulations.
Demonstrates appropriate behavior towards residents, families, co-workers, visitors by controlling anger, angry feelings or outbursts.
Maintains a level of customer service to residents, family members, visitors in keeping with Sancta Maria’s mission and standards of excellence.
Understands Facility Abuse Policy and Procedure to recognize signs/symptoms of abuse, neglect, exploitation, and misappropriation and reporting responsibilities.
Recognizes needs of residents with dementia and adapts care accordingly and as trained.
Recognizes age specific differences/responsibilities in care for adult and geriatric residents.
Attends and participates in educational classes/seminars as scheduled maintaining minimum of 12-hours of education per year from date of hire.
Assists nurse with admitting, transferring, and discharging residents
Maintains dependable attendance and punctuality and adheres to assigned work schedule.
Wears Facility ID badge in full view for residents, families and co-workers while on-duty.

 Sancta Maria is a non-profit, mission driven, 134-bed skilled nursing facility. Excellent pay and benefits. Located on the Cambridge/Belmont line with free on-site parking and accessible by public transportation. Your Health Insurance plan premiums are paid 75% by Sancta Maria AND we have a Health Savings Account that pays up to $3,000 of your deductibles. Our employees love our health insurance plans and tell us that no other Nursing Faclity can compete!! The Sancta Maria is a small, independent, non-profit skilled nursing facility that believes teamwork is the recipe for success. We have successfully surrounded ourselves with incredible employees who embrace their responsibilities, demonstrate compassion for our Residents and Patients, and who enjoy and appreciate their colleagues. If working in a "family oriented" environment appeals to you, then we hope that you will forward along your resume, and wish you good luck during the interview process.x

Direct recording and operates video production switcher and programs character generator. Job Description:

 Our large non-profit in Washington, DC is looking for a full-time SEO Strategist for a long term role onsite in DC.

MUST HAVE a strong organic search history and be able to create/ implement strategies to improve search ranking for highly competitive keywords.

Establish product, service and product development priorities based on projected results considering overall short and long term returns against the assets and resources expended. Work closely with other departments to ensure Marketing priorities are consistent with the strategic plan and activities match established and agreed to priorities; Conduct customer and competitive research to ensure that the company is providing its customers with the products, technical support and services they desire at prices that generate the greatest total dollar return to the Company across its total product line. Research to identify new product and services opportunities that match our core competencies; Develop and provide marketing materials to support all product and service sales efforts including those of our sister companies and distributors. Support internal communications, marketing, training, motivational and incentive development efforts; Identify and implement procedures and systems to ensure the Company’s marketing support functions are consistent and as efficient as possible while meeting internal and external customer needs.

This individual must be strategic, analytical, organized, and efficient – often managing multiple SEO projects and priorities at one time. Mastery of SEO best practices, and proficient in technical SEO initiatives. Expert user of SEO software without a dependency (Conductor Searchlight, Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, and SEMRush). Strong proficiency with web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics) and a strategic thinker. Track record for delivering projects and completing tasks on time. Solid understanding of online marketing reporting and quantitative analysis. Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills: enthusiastic, team player, professional, well organized, self-starter, serious commitment to hard work.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

• Contribute to the achievement of established department goals and objectives and adheres to department policies, procedures, quality standards and safety standards.

• Develop, manage and implement holistic SEO strategies.

• Improve traffic and search ranking for priority keywords for 15 marketing channels.

• Partner with developers and content specialists to promote SEO best practices.

• Pro-actively analyze SEO performance and conducts ongoing technical audits, identifies technical limitations, analyzes site health and recommend and implement strategies.

Identifies opportunities and analyze key performance indicators in the marketplace to improve search visibility, and consistently improve engagement resulting in qualified traffic through organic search.

• Analyzes, strategizes, implements, monitors, and report ongoing SEO efforts to stakeholders on ensuring that business goals are met.

• Leverage dashboard data and reports to evaluate the degree of success of SEO efforts to develop and recommend SEO initiatives and campaigns.

• Execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights in order to create monthly, quarterly and yearly SEO strategies.

Professional Competencies:

• Ability to foster strong business relationships at various levels.

• Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.

• Ability to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points.

• High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.

• Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills.

Qualifications:

• 5+ years of leading SEO initiatives and strategies including experience in the execution of SEO recommendations with a proven track record of results.

• Sound business acumen, financial analysis skills, strategic skills and common sense.

• Demonstrated knowledge in analyzing and interpreting complex data.

• Proficient and superior skill sets with: Excel, • PowerPoint, Word and Outlook.

• Proven ability to manage projects to successful completion, multi-task and work within deadlines.

• Can lead as well as function as part of a team.

• Able to perform in depth keyword research and industry research.

• Full understanding of Google Trends and how to leverage for search.

• Determine scope of new SEO projects in coordination with business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities.

• Ability to perform content gap analysis and create recommendations in coordination with elements and structure of websites and web pages.

• Core skill to provide recommendations and execute/manage strategies for SEO goals – general and keyword specific.

• Core skill to implement and administer SEO functional requirements for XML sitemaps (video, news, and standard), robots.txt, canonicals, taxonomy, and schema).

• Core skill to monitor and evaluate search results and search performance across the major search channels in order to improve rankings. Local, Universal, Voice, Image.

• Core skill to monitor, analyze, and evaluate web analytics dashboards and reports in order to develop and recommend SEO strategies.

• Core skill to understand the integration opportunities between organic and paid search.

• Core skill to provide oversight and serve as quality control when working with various stakeholders.

• Create and optimize local map listings on Google My Business and citations.

• Work with the management team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented.

• Define requirements, tasks, acceptance criteria and resources associated to SEO strategy.

• Keep pace with SEO, search engine and internet marketing industry trends and development. 

Ideal Candidate:

• Experienced leading successful online marketing campaigns for businesses.

• Conductor certified.

• SEMrush certified.

• Strong knowledge of Google Search Console.

• Strong knowledge of Bing Webmaster Tools.

• Strong leadership skills and enthusiasm.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• Mastery of Local Search.

• Mastery of Image Search.

• Mastery of Video Search.

• Understanding of the key principles of Voice Search.

• Experience with Site-Search strategy.

• The ability to fill in for Paid Search strategically in an emergency.

• Able to innovate and develop new search strategies, techniques, and methods.

• Experienced with WordPress and Content • Management Systems.

• Strong knowledge of search engine guidelines, algorithms and current ranking factors.

• Strong understanding of Google Webmaster Guidelines.

• Passion for SEO and overall search marketing.

• High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.

• Ability to clearly and effectively articulate thoughts and points.

• Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.

• Outstanding ability to think creatively, strategically and identify and resolve problems.

We are a distinctive retirement community, offering Assisted Living, Residential and Long Term Care services to our residents. We are recognized for and take pride in providing exceptional care, compassion and quality of life both to our residents and our employees. Working at The Leland Home is a chance to make a difference in the life of our residents and support the best quality of life for them.

https://www.lelandhome.org/

The Leland Home provides a safe and affordable residence for persons age 62 and over who desire or need assistance in their daily living. We seek to maintain the dignity and independence of our residents by offering a warm friendly and home-like setting.

We are actively taking every measure to protect our Residents and Employees, during the COVID19 situation.

• Must remain awake for entire overnight shift

• A passion for providing excellent care to the senior community

jobDetails:
Job Summary:

The Community Development Analyst will lead collaboration with internal and external partners, including employers, policymakers, researchers and community organizations, to support the execution of engagements that have the potential for improving economic outcomes for low and moderate income communities. Current strategic areas of focus include the racial wealth divide, the quality of jobs, and access to banking and financial services. Over the long term, Community Development Analysts are asked to collaborate on a portfolio projects that further support the goal of promoting economic growth in lower-income communities.

Principal Accountabilities:

 Completing research and analysis needed to inform program strategies and enhance implementation
 Managing work streams that support programs, or broader strategies
 Engaging with key stakeholders, policymakers, researchers and thought leaders to identify emerging issues and possible solutions across a portfolio of work;
 Contributing to research and drafting of briefing papers, planning documents, and reports, and making oral presentations;
 Contributing to and co-leading the design, and implementation of convening key stakeholders to share ideas and promising approaches, inform key decisions, and mobilize action;
 Collaborating with community development staff at other Federal Reserve Banks on joint efforts; and
 Developing and informing strategies and interventions to improve employment outcomes for low- and moderate income individuals.

Other Accountabilities
 Support the unit and the broader department with data, research, and insights as needed
 Work closely with Director of Strategy and broader department in staying abreast of COVID-19 related trends and the specific implications for quality jobs
 Track leading considerations and programs by key stakeholders related to COVID-19
 Identify practical and tangible solutions that are being development internally and externally with regards to the long-term shifts in the quality of jobs post COVID-19

Supervision:

Not required to supervise other staff.

Knowledge and Experience:

Knowledge and experience acquired through a degree in public policy, business administration, economics, or related field from an accredited academic institution or 5 years of experience working as an analyst or program manager.

Passion and commitment for public service that makes a meaningful difference in the lives of low- and moderate-income communities;

Demonstrated track-record of moving programs from ideas, to delivery, to achieving results

Strong project management skills and relationship management experience

Strong ability to research, draft, propose, execute, and adapt strategies to address complex problems;

Experience analyzing complex and large qualitative and quantitative data sets

Demonstrated ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders, including research institutions, non-profits, foundations, government, and the private sector, as well as with individuals at all levels of an organization;

Ability to speak and write effectively, including communicating complicated issues in an easily understood manner, and the ability to translate research into accessible information to practitioners and the general public;

Knowledge of local, regional, state and national programs, stakeholders, and policies related to job quality

All employees assigned to this position will be subject to FBI fingerprint/ criminal background and Patriot Act/ Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) watch list checks at least once every five years.

The Federal Reserve Bank of Boston is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and to provide equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, disability, or military service.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work required of this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities or skills associated with this position or the personnel so classified. While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of this position, management reserves the right to revise this or any job description at its discretion at any time.

Design and implement continuous delivery pipelines that serve the purpose of provisioning non-prod and production environments

Develop deployment automation for any type of workload (Application, database, caching, Mobile, etc.) on Azure using industry standard deployment and configuration tools.

Develop tools and solutions to integrate, automate, and orchestrate cloud operational needs using Automation, Azure DevOps and ARM templates.

Define and bring in “Continuous Integration and Continuous deployment” standard methodologies

Recommend a migration and consolidation strategy for DevOps tools

Manage DevOps security and compliance

Partner with Development teams to identify the workload patterns and deliver the suitable deployment automation

Document deployment automation and pipeline details and effectively socialize with DEV teams to educate and demonstrate

Provide systems support including responding to monitoring alerts.

Implement and stay abreast of Cloud and Kubernetes industry standard methodologies and tooling

Azure Cloud– DevOps engineer Cloud platform experience

Kubernetes experience

Temporary Cluster Substitute Teacher -Full Time

Grade Level: Elementary

Start Date: August- December 2020

Locations: Various

About UP Education Network

UP Education Network is a school turnaround organization whose mission is to rapidly transform chronically underperforming district schools into extraordinary schools that sustain high achievement over time. UP transforms schools into exceptional learning environments in partnership with families and communities. Students in UP schools cultivate sharp minds, share their kind hearts, and explore their path and potential. UP graduates succeed on the path to college and pursue their passions. Today, UP is the largest nonprofit school network in Massachusetts and is privileged to serve a highly diverse group of more than 2,500 PK-8th grade students across five schools in Boston and Lawrence. All of our school based staff are district employees and receive district benefits.

Teaching at UP Education Network

Teachers hold primary responsibility for the development of curriculum, the instruction of content, and, most importantly, the success of UP Academy’s students.

At UP, your career is shaped by:

Opportunities for immediate impact: UP offers a chance to bring best practices found in high-performing schools to students previously enrolled in struggling schools, and to rapidly unlock the potential of these students.Talented, mission-driven colleagues: Our staff is enthusiastic, dedicated, and willing to do “whatever it takes” to put every student on the path to college.Collaboration and teamwork: Staff members collaborate and work closely together on grade-level or content area teams, using data to track student performance as well as guide instructional practice.Consistent professional growth and development: Members of our staff typically have bi-weekly check-in meetings with their managers where they receive targeted coaching and support. Additionally, the entire staff participates in weekly professional development sessions during the school year, kick-started by extensive training in August. 


Role

The Cluster Substitute is a full-time member of the school staff and plays the critical role of providing daily coverage at their specific campus as needed to ensure consistency in academic programming. Cluster Substitutes also have regular duties in the course of the day, similar to lead teachers. Cluster Substitutes participate in all ongoing professional development and receive ongoing coaching from instructional leaders. Cluster Substitutes at UP Academies often move into teaching positions after being successful in their role.Responsibilities:

Effectively execute lesson plans for assigned classesPerform all assigned school dutiesConsistently hold students accountable to school-based behavior management planParticipate in school-wide professional development and activities, as well as cohort meetingsCommunicating effectively with all students, staff and families

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree is required, Master’s degree is preferredCurrent authorization to work in the United States – A candidate must have such authorization by his or her first day of employment.A passionate belief in UP Academy’s mission, values, and educational model;A deep desire to work with educationally underserved student populations and their families;An unwavering commitment to the academic success and personal development of our students;An eagerness to set ambitious, challenging, and tangible goals, and a relentless drive to achieve them;An ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a capacity to remain calm and focused when faced with unexpected challenges;Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including strong public speaking skills;A sense of humility

Compensation:

We offer a competitive compensation package including comprehensive health benefits.

We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply for any open position for which they are qualified. Our students must be exposed on a daily basis to a diverse group of powerful role models. Therefore, we have a responsibility to recruit, retain, develop, and reward a diverse and talented staff from a wide range of backgrounds to join our creative, mission-driven team.

Company Overview

829 Studios has been named to the Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Privately Held Companies, Boston Business Journal's Fast 50 (Massachusetts' 50 Fastest-Growing Private Companies) and HubSpot's Top Digital Agencies list. Our projects and team members have received recognition from the Hospitality Sales and Marketing Association International (HSMAI), Awwwards and other marketing industry publications. Our clients include venture-backed start-ups, publicly traded companies, non-profit organizations and more. We're proud to be working with Stanley Black & Decker, OARS, Micato Safaris, Hilton Hotels, AOA Adventures, Leave No Trace and many more.

What You'll Be Doing

Were looking for someone to join our team on a temporary basis, approximately two months. This position will act as the front line for 829 Studios by engaging with prospective customers and working with Account Executives to close the deal. By sourcing pipeline via direct outreach based on our prospect database and your own research, you will help grow the sales team and build a scalable, repeatable process. A successful candidate will be a quick learner with high acumen for and desire to learn sales.

 Must-Haves

BA/BS, ideally in Marketing, Communications, Business, or relevant work experience0-2 years sales experience, particularly in marketing/advertising / SMB markets. Job-Specific Responsibilities

We are looking for a motivated Back-end Software Engineer to join the Department of Biomedical Informatics at Harvard Medical School, for an exciting opportunity in steering how clinical genomics data will be analyzed and annotated in a new genomics analysis platform.

Genome sequencing is becoming a routine approach for diagnosing genetic diseases, as well as discovering new disease mechanisms. As the number of patients referred to genetic screening is increasing, there is a clear need to build effective solutions to manage their data for clinical applications and discovery research.

The Clinical Genomic Analysis Platform (CGAP) at Harvard Medical School is envisioned as a scalable research and clinical web-based application for analysis, annotation, visualization, and reporting of genomic data. CGAP is developed by a multidisciplinary diverse team of clinical geneticists, bioinformatics scientists and software engineers. The working environment combines the best features of a startup (fast pace, flexibility, flat hierarchies) with those of one of the leading medical schools (excellent benefits, outstanding opportunities for learning, great resources, brand recognition).

The Back-end Software Engineer is responsible for leveraging the content and capabilities of our growing next-generation sequencing data. The scope of this role will include responsibility on data integrity, processing data at scale, serving content to the front-ends, integrations with internal and external systems, and end-to-end testing. The back-end software engineer will be working closely with other engineers, as well as computational, experimental and clinical geneticists.

Harvard Medical School

COMPANY SUMMARY:  We are a new healthcare model. Through our innovative model of care, we provide healthcare to our patients when they want and where they want; our visits to our patients can be as short as 60 minutes or as long as 24 hours / 7 days per week. We want to break down the walls that patients sometimes incur - by doing so, we have founded Nursing on Demand.  Would you like to be part of a new healthcare delivery model that will be like no other organization you have worked for?! We are looking for healthcare professionals who are willing to work per diem / on-call. If you are able to work 60 minutes a day or up to 24 hours days – then we are interested in speaking with you.  The care we provide can be in homes, places of work and assisted livings, as well as similar environments. We also provide temporary nurses to hospitals, SNFs and other related environments. You choose where and when you want to work.  POSITION SUMMARY:  The nurse will work with patients and their family members. They will provide patient education, treatment, and emotional support to help these individuals recover from injuries, illnesses or other healthcare concerns. Our nurses will provide care to our most cherished individuals in our community (primarily adults and the elderly). Nursing skills this position can expect to utilize, range from assisting in the everyday care of a patient who cannot care for themselves to more acute care such as: Wound care, Rx reconciliation, vital sign checks, IV medications, medication reconciliation, glucose monitoring, ADLs and more. We are committed to our patients and their families, we will provide emotional support to our patients and their families including last minute needs, overnight care and/or travel companionship just to name a few.  This is an opportunity for a conscientious, self-motivated nurse with excellent organizational skills to join us in reaching out to the community providing hands on experience to our patients and their families in our surrounding community.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  The nurse is essential that the nurse is able to identify patient care requirements by establishing personal rapport with the patient and their family within the scope of her/his licensure. The RN sees patients in their homes, places of work or wherever the patient would like the care delivered. We provide direct skilled nursing in the context of both scheduled and urgent visits.

Establishes a compassionate environment by providing emotional, psychological, and spiritual support to patients, and their families.
Promotes patient’s independence by establishing patient care goals; teaching patient, and family to understand condition, medications, and self-care skills and patient’s limits.
Assess a patient through obtaining the history, performing appropriate tests, making or collecting observations from the participant and caregivers.
Arranges for or directly implements care plan interventions and testing, treatment, or other provider orders.
Safely and effectively administers medications, tests, and treatments as ordered of all patient medications with appropriate authorizations by the provider.
Teaches patients' and families' health care regimens. Explains and provides information regarding disease and wellness, tests, results, medications, diet, exercise, and other aspects of the plan of care to patients.
Uses sound clinical judgment to accurately assess patient problems during visits and responds both with nursing interventions and by bringing concerns to the attention of the patient’s primary care team as appropriate
Communicates clearly and professionally with patients and caregivers
Maintain real-time documentation/reports during each visit, this should include thorough medical information.
Provide care and compassion for our elders that may have ailments – not limited to Dementia/ Alzheimer’s in our community and support the caregiver to prevent burn out.
Documentation of nursing visits
Other duties, as assigned

REQUIREMENTS: 

Current Massachusetts RN or LPN license in good standing
Current Massachusetts driver’s license and reliable transportation
Minimum of one (1) year of nursing experience preferred, but not required. VNA experience a plus.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
Experience with documenting in electronic medical record strongly preferred
Must be a fluent communicator (English); bilingual is a plus. Excellent clinical skills, bedside manner, infection control, nursing skills, physiological knowledge, administering medications, medical teamwork, multi-tasking, listening, verbal communication, health promotion and maintenance.
Must be able to pass a criminal background check
Must feel comfortable seeing our clients in their homes.

The Collateralized Debt Obligation Group (CDO) is a division within Corporate Trust Services. CDOs are structured finance vehicles that issue both debt and equity liabilities, with the proceeds being used to buy a portfolio of collateral. Typical types of collateral include syndicated bank loans, corporate bonds, asset-backed securities, mortgage-backed securities, and Mezzanine debt. Responsibilities include: settles bond/bank loan trades and invests excess cash as directed by the Portfolio Manager, books cash inflows/outflows to the portfolio, tracks asset attributes such as accrual information, rating, industry codes, etc., provides reports to the clients on a daily basis, and assists Analysts with reporting to the investors. Ensures 100% accuracy and timeliness of data through proper booking and reconciliation of account activity.

Basic Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree in finance or related field, or equivalent work experience

- One to two years of experience in collateral portfolios and/or mutual funds

Preferred Skills/Experience

- Strong organizational skills and detail-oriented

- Basic indenture interpretation abilities and analytical skills

- Effective verbal and written communication skills

- Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously

- Ability to work both independently and as a team player

- Proficient computer skills, especially Microsoft Office applications

- Some knowledge of Wallstreet Office, SEI, and CDO Suite preferred

Job Title: CDO Cash Administrator

Client Job ID: 627703

Duration: 12 Months Contract to Hire

Hours: Mon – Fri 9am – 5pm

Location: Boston, MA 02110 – Will be remote till after COVID 19 and then in the office

Job Description:

The Collateralized Debt Obligation Group (CDO) is a division within Corporate Trust Services. CDOs are structured finance vehicles that issue both debt and equity liabilities, with the proceeds being used to buy a portfolio of collateral. Typical types of collateral include syndicated bank loans, corporate bonds, asset-backed securities, mortgage-backed securities, and Mezzanine debt.

Responsibilities include:

Settles bond/bank loan trades and invests excess cash as directed by the Portfolio Manager,

Books cash inflows/outflows to the portfolio,

Tracks asset attributes such as accrual information, rating, industry codes, etc.,

Provides reports to the clients on a daily basis,

Assists Analysts with reporting to the investors.

Ensures 100% accuracy and timeliness of data through proper booking and reconciliation of account activity.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor''s degree in finance or related field, or equivalent work experience

One to two years of experience in collateral portfolios and/or mutual funds

Preferred Skills/Experience

Strong organizational skills and detail-oriented

Basic indenture interpretation abilities and analytical skills

Effective verbal and written communication skills

Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously

Ability to work both independently and as a team player

Proficient computer skills, especially Microsoft Office applications

Some knowledge of Wallstreet Office, SEI, and CDO Suite preferred

GENERAL SUMMARY/ OVERVIEW STATEMENT: Su
The MGH Sample Processing Laboratory (SPL) provides services involved in preparing research samples obtained from patients enrolled in clinical trials of investigational cancer treatments for storage and shipment. The primary role of this position is to transport samples from the holding stations located in the patient treatment areas of the hospital to the SPL and assist with their storage in ultralow temperature freezers.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Transport samples from holding stations in patient treatment areas to the Sample Processing Laboratory (SPL).
Transport packaging and shipping materials from other areas of the hospital to the SPL.
Assist with storing processed samples in the ultralow temperature freezers in GRJ1004.
Verify the temporary sticker on each sample transport tube and place them in the proper fiberboard storage box in the freezers based upon the DFCI protocol number.
Assist with packaging samples for shipment as needed in collaboration with the Clinical Laboratory Assistants responsible for shipping.
Transport packages to the MGH Mail Room for courier service pick up.
Provides assistance to disease group Clinical Research Coordinators (CRCs) working in the clinical areas of the hospital with unpacking, stocking, and organizing supplies such as kits, tubes, and shippers used as a consumable supply for a clinical trial.
Assist with or perform any other tasks as directed by senior laboratory staff.



SKILLS/ABILITIES/COMPETENCIES REQUIRED:



Ability to walk long distances within the hospital while carrying a sample transport container or pushing a cart on a continuous basis throughout the work day.
Ability to lift boxes that are moderately heavy (
Responsible for carrying a communication device (i.e. a pager) and responding to pages within a few minutes. Prioritizes workload based on demands of patient care.
Effective interpersonal communication skills.
A high level of responsibility and ability to work effectively with minimal direct supervision.
Ability to use Microsoft Office programs.



LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, and/or REGISTRATIONS (if applicable):
None
EDUCATION:
H.S. diploma or equivalent.
EXPERIENCE:
None
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):
None
FISCAL RESPONSIBILITY (if applicable):
None
WORKING CONDITIONS:



Duties will be performed within the hospital requiring the ability to work standing up and while walking for prolonged periods and lifting moderately heavy packages and objects.
Handling biological specimens, dry-ice, and other potentially hazardous materials.
The position involves a 40 hour work week, 8 hours/day Monday-Friday with a 30 min break, typically from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., although the shift is subject to change to accommodate samples collected during the normal operating hours of outpatient clinics.



HS Diploma Required

jobDetails:
Green Corps is looking for motivated students to help us on an exciting corporate campaign asking Stop&Shop to cut ties with meat producers like Cargill that are responsible for devastating deforestation and water pollution in South America. The campaign is being organized in collaboration with Mighty Earth. As volunteers or interns, students will help us to build grassroots power and work with volunteers, local organizations, and participate in environmental advocacy. With this work, they can join us in addressing one of the biggest threats to our planet: climate change. Interns will also help with Green Corps recruitment and program work. Tasks can include (but will not be limited to) helping to plan a petitioning events, rallies and forums, and learning to train future advocates for the environmental movement.

Over the next several months, we will be organizing community events, working with the media, collecting petition signatures, and building a broad coalition of businesses to join us in asking Stop&Shop to hold Cargill accountable, and showing them that customers in their home state of Massachusetts do not want to buy meat that contributes unnecessary pollution and carbon emission.

Interns will lead and assist with a wide variety of campaign tasks. Good verbal and writing skills are important as interns will recruit and train volunteers, and lead meetings. Applicants should be willing to devote 10-15 hours per week to campaign work, but schedules can be adjusted to accommodate class, work, and personal preferences.

Locations: Online, but efforts will be focused in Amherst and Boston, MA

Term: We are looking to hire interns immediately, to work through to late July.

Hours: 10-15 hours per week preferred for Interns. Schedules are flexible around class and work!

Compensation: We are unable to provide compensation for interns, but the internship will provide the opportunity to develop skills such as: public speaking, managing and training volunteers, goal-setting, fundraising and most importantly how to organize folks who care about an issue to make a big impact!

Job Type: Internship

Salary: $0.00 /hour

Application Question:

Why are you interested in an internship position with Green Corps? Your answer should include your motivations to work on this issue and any background/experience.

Work Location:

Multiple locationsFully Remote

Benefits:

Work from homeFlexible scheduleProfessional development assistance

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Company's website:

greencorps.org, mightyearth.org

Work Remotely:

Temporarily due to COVID-19

Our agency is expanding tremendously here in Marlborough! Our dynamic team is hard working, high energy, AND fun. This is a career opportunity where every day is a different experience. Our organization came to Massachusetts in 2017 and has spent the past 2 years dedicated to what we do best and take pride in: providing supplemental benefits to working families by building long-term relationships.
We're looking for great communicators who are ambitious, motivated, and also team players. Having a positive mindset is also a must. Prior experience in Sales is not required, but a background in Customer Service is preferred. Our comprehensive PAID training program is tailored to every new hire's experience level. Opportunities for advancement into management available for review after three months.
The job itself consists of meeting with members who have signed up to receive supplemental benefit plans that help protect their families far beyond what is covered through their employer. Our LEADS ARE PROVIDED at no cost and endorsed by the unions that we service. We do not cold call, prospect, or sell door to door. Some of our closest groups consist of Mass Police Association, Mass Nurses Association, Teamsters, Postal Workers, IBEW, SEIU, etc
If you are ready to make a difference in both your life and also the lives of others, please apply by submitting your resume. If your background is a fit, a member of our Recruiting team will be in touch with next steps in the process. Thank you!

We will be conducting all interviews virtually via ZOOM. We will also be conducting our training process through Zoom in efforts to keep everyone safe and healthy - while at the same time able to kickstart a new career!
Our mission has always been to protect people and provide unlimited opportunities!Anyone looking for a new opportunity, we're now aggressively filling positions full time.No experience necessary, full PAID training provided. jobDetails:
Purpose of the role

The Portfolio Analyst role spans a broad spectrum of research, investment, and technical tasks. The successful candidate for this highly competitive position will work closely with a team of Portfolio Managers and other talented Portfolio Analysts to implement Numeric's investment strategies. This involves both validating the inputs to our models as well as the output from the quantitative signals used to make buy/sell decisions. The Portfolio Analyst will also monitor portfolio risk and country/sector exposures, analyze portfolio returns, and conduct analysis for client communications. In addition to the

day-to-day implementation of Numeric's strategies, successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute to research projects in conjunction with Numeric's central research team.

Specific responsibilities

Work with Portfolio Managers to validate the inputs and outputs of our investment signals and assist with the day to day management of the portfolioAnalyze the output of our portfolio construction process to ensure the integrity of our investment philosophy Assist research and portfolio management teams with enhancing existing signals and creating new signalsWork with large data sets and liaise with outside data vendors to identify data quality issues Design tools for evaluating portfolio implementation and performanceConduct analysis for client communication and presentations

Key competencies

Minimum of undergraduate coursework in finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics or accounting.Previous coding experience in Python, Matlab or R necessary0-3 years of quantitative analysis experience preferredSolid understanding of accounting and financial statement analysisStrong programming and statistical analysis skillsStrong work ethic and flexible work scheduleDetail oriented, good communication skills and a collaborative personalityStrong sense of integrity

About Man Numeric

Man Numeric employs systematic security-selection processes that are underpinned by a bottom-up, fundamental approach, offering both long only and alternative strategies. The team’s highly experienced professionals operate collaboratively, distilling their analytical and investment expertise into systematic processes which are applied across regions, styles, and capitalisations.

Man Numeric has a strong history in public equities, focusing on bottom-up stock selection processes based on fundamental, causal market relationships and reinforced by continuous research. Its approach seeks to capitalise on temporary market inefficiencies, with models that look to identify mispricing opportunities. Furthermore, the engine seeks to innovate continually and research new areas and opportunities. Man Numeric has significant capabilities in systematic responsible investing, with around half of its assets managed employing some form of sustainability screen.

Founded in 1989 and becoming part of Man Group in 2014, Man Numeric’s funds under management were $35.9 billion at 31 December 2019. Further information can be found at www.man.com/numeric.

Work-Life Balance and Benefits at Man

Man Group is proud to provide the best working environment possible for all of its employees, and we are committed to equality of opportunity. At Man Group we believe that a diverse workforce is a critical factor in the success of our business, and this is embedded in our culture and values. We run a number of external and internal initiatives, partnerships and programmes that help us to attract and develop talent from diverse backgrounds and encourage diversity and inclusion across our firm and industry. https://www.man.com/diversity. Man Group is also a Signatory of the Women in Finance Charter.

Man Group supports many charities, and global initiatives. We support professional training and development, and requests for flexible or part-time working. Employees are also offered two 'Mankind' days of paid leave per year as part of the Man Charitable Trust's community volunteering programme.

We offer comprehensive, firm-wide employee benefits including competitive holiday entitlements, pension/401k, life and long-term disability coverage, group sick pay, enhanced parental leave and long-service leave. Additional benefits are tailored to local markets and may include private medical coverage, discounted gym membership and wellbeing programmes.

jobDetails:
This Direct Hire recruitment is to fill positions based on a critical hiring need resulting from the outbreak and spread of the"Coronavirus Disease 2019" (COVID-19), which has caused a public health emergency. As such, all applicants who meet the OPM Public Health Program Specialist Series requirements and the minimum specialized experience qualifications stated in this announcement will be referred to hiring managers for further consideration.

Education completed in colleges or universities outside the United States may be used to meet the education requirements. You must provide acceptable documentation that the foreign education is comparable to that received in an accredited educational institution in the United States. For more information on how foreign education is evaluated, visit: https://www.cdc.gov/jobs/future-applicant-information.html.As a Physical Scientist, you will:


Review and evaluate existing and proposed requirements for protective technology and protective product design, performance, quality and reliability. Develop and recommend the use of product safety standards and associated operational and testing procedures to support proposed Federal regulations, national standards, and policy interpretations.Utilize and/or design systems or components for the purpose of sensing, monitoring, measuring and preventing hazards.Plan and conduct studies. Prepare reports of findings. Prepare investigative protocols and identifies required equipment. Participate in the development, calibration and operation of research instrumentation for laboratory experiments and field tests.Assist in the design, development, and conduct of research projects concerned with the prevention and control of physical hazards.Perform other duties as assigned.


Continuation of Requirements:


Promotion Potential: Please be advised there is no promotion potential for these positions, any position filled with this announcement will be filled at the single grade level requested.Research position: NoSupervisory position: NoTerm appointments may be shortened or extended up to a maximum of four years based on the needs of the agency without further competition. Subsequent employment for CDC positions must be through the appropriate competitive process or special employment program hiring authorities.


BASIC QUALS:

Applicants must have a degree: physical science, engineering, or mathematics that included 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science such as mechanics, dynamics, properties of materials, and electronics. OR have a combination of education and experience -- education equivalent to one of the majors shown in A above that included at least 24 semester hours in physical science and/or related engineering science, plus appropriate experience or additional education.

MINIMUM QUALS:

GS-07: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at/or equivalent to the GS-05 grade level in the Federal service to include experience participating in the development, calibration and operation of research instrumentation for laboratory experiments and field tests. OR have completed one year of graduate level education or superior academic achievement in a field of study directly related to the work of this position. OR have a combination of experience and education that meets 100% of the qualification requirements.

GS-09: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at/or equivalent to the GS-07 grade level in the Federal service to include experience preparing samples, devises and running experiments and tests to include assisting in the interpretation of the results. OR have completed 2 full years of progressively higher level graduate education OR possess a Master's or equivalent graduate degree (such as an LL.B. or J.D.), if related. OR have a combination of specialized experience and graduate level education that meets 100% of the qualification requirements for this position.

GS-11: Applicants must have one year of specialized experience at/or equivalent to at least the GS-09 grade level in the Federal service, to include experience designing and development of experimental equipment, instrumentation and prototype systems to monitor, measure and evaluate hazards. OR have a Ph.D, or equivalent doctoral degree or 3 full years of progressively higher level graduate education leading to a doctoral degree or LL.M. from an accredited college or university directly related to the work of the position to be filled. OR have a combination of graduate level education and experience that meets 100% of the qualification requirements for this position.

GS-12: Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service to include experience performing scientific studies to evaluate chemical, radiological and/or biological hazards and to assess the performance of protective equipment.
