jobDetails: A brief update on Covid-19 (coronavirus)Simply Business is well prepared to deal with unprecedented events. We’re an agile business by nature – and our hiring and interview process is no exception. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, some parts of our hiring process may take a little longer than usual. Please bear with us, and rest assured that we're happy to hear from you and receive your application.If it looks like you could be a good fit for the role, we’ll ask you to interview on Zoom – you’ll need WiFi and a laptop, or a 4G-enabled smartphone. If you don’t have access to either of these, or you need support with your application, get in touch with us at careers@simplybusiness.co.uk. Similarly, please email us if you’re not well, you’re self-isolating, or if you want to pause your application for a bit – we’ll be happy to keep you updated on future opportunities like the one below.Simply Business is more than our name. It's how we approach insurance: Make it clear. Make it simple. Make it affordable. By combining exceptional talent, technology, data, and knowledge, Simply Business is the go-to online insurance brokerage that protects small businesses and the entrepreneurs who work hard to build them. We want team members who have the drive to challenge boundaries. If you’re smart and passionate about delivering brilliant customer experiences, we’d love to hear from you.The Data and Analytics department aims to inspire and empower Simply Business to create value through data. As a US Director of Insights, you will lead a team of talented Insight Analysts, inform the business strategy and be the most senior Data and Analytics person in the US.As the most senior Data and Analytics member in the US, you will have a fantastic opportunity to drive our business forward by informing the strategy and by partnering with all departments that need insight. You are expected to put your strategic, analytical and managerial skills to use in the context of a data-hungry and agile organization.Responsibilities Include:Grow, manage, and motivate a team of Insight AnalystsDevelop relationships and provide proactive insight to senior stakeholdersUnderstand the business priorities and challenges to make sure the team is working on the most valuable areasOwn, understand and prioritize development for US data capabilities and data flowsProvide ongoing support and insight to the Management, Product and Operational teamsAct as subject matter expert for data analysis and product discovery / hypothesis testingBe an active member of the Data and Analytics leadership teamWe are looking for:8+ years of similar experience leading, coaching and developing Insight teamsExperience managing senior stakeholders and driving strategy through dataExtensive and demonstrable SQL experienceExperience with modern reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, Mode or QlikviewSome experience in Data Modelling techniques is highly desirableSome programming experience with Python or Ruby is desirableE-commerce experience is highly desirableDemonstrable experience of combining analytical results with intuition and creativity, and a range of sources to build comprehensive and holistic recommendationsProven experience in leading and growing Insight teamsA can-do attitude and desire to drive changeCompelling storytellerFlexible, proactive and positive individualExperience with matrix managementWhat are the benefits?Here are some of the great benefits and perks that come from being a Simply Business employee:• A salary that reflects your experience, our pay policy, and the market we’re in from your first day• Group plan for medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage• Short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance coverage• Participation in the Company’s bonus program• Participation in 401(k) plan with a 3% employer match• Commuter benefits to help cut down on commuting costs• 25 days of vacation time plus 10 company holidays• Flexible working hours and working from home• Annual company trip, regular outings, and volunteer opportunities • An awesome WeWork office with cold brew coffee and other beverages on tap, local pop-up events, and more As a company, we pride ourselves on inclusion in the workplace. Simply Business is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Want more info on working at Simply Business? Check out our careers page: https://www.simplybusiness.com/careers/

At this time workers across the country are impacted by this crisis, specifically those employed in retail, restaurant, hospitality and the travel industry. At Trader Joe's we are working diligently to support our communities and ensure our customers have access to food and necessary household staples during this time. To those who have found their hours limited or jobs placed on hold, we invite you to join our Crew until your employer is able to welcome you back.

Is it you? 

Our Crew Members create a warm and friendly shopping experience in our stores. We answer questions, offer suggestions and ensure our customers know they are welcomed and cared for. We entertain customers and make grocery shopping an exciting adventure. Some responsibilities may include:


Working on teams to accomplish goalsOperating the cash register in a fun and efficient mannerBagging groceries with careStocking shelvesCreating signage to inform and delight customersHelping customers find their favorite products

You'll learn a lot. You aren't stuck doing one task here. Each Crew Member contributes to a WOW customer experience by participating in all aspects of the job.

If you have a passion for people and a fervor for food, we'd love to meet you. We can teach you the rest.

Trader Joe's is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.

OneStaff Medical is seeking a travel nurse RN ED - Emergency Department for a travel nursing job in Everett, Massachusetts:



Specialty: ED - Emergency Department
Discipline: RN
Start Date: ASAP
Duration: 13 weeks
36 hours per week
Shift: 12 hours, nights


Additional information: OneStaff Job ID #206462. Pay package is based on 12 hour shifts and 36 hours per week (subject to confirmation) with tax-free stipend amount to be determined. Posted job title: RN ER - EMERGENCY ROOM 12 Hour Night Shift Position Available..

Emergency Nurses treat patients in emergency situations where theyre experiencing trauma or injury. These nurses quickly recognize life-threatening problems and are trained to help solve them on the spot. They can work in hospital emergency rooms, ambulances, helicopters, urgent care centers, sports arenas, and more. As an Emergency Nurse, youll treat a variety of conditions from sore throats to heart attacks for patients of all ages and backgrounds..

You deserve a partner that is working for you. Be bold and let us do just that. Well take care of you while you are away from your own home base in every way we can, and ideally do more than you expect.

Your team at OneStaff is dedicated to finding the perfect assignments (for you), negotiate the best rates and handles any issues that may arise while you are on assignment. We take great pride in building relationships with our traveling professionals and we enjoy hearing about your experiences. Whatever the need, we are here to help along the journey.

We understand you are the heart and soul of what we are. Whether it is housing, payroll, travel, benefits, or just a friendly voice to talk to, we are there every step of the way. The company you choose is the most important decision you will make in your traveling career. We get that, so were committed to you 24 hours-a-day, 7 days-a-week. Were your one solution in travel assignments and here to assist whether helping with accelerating your trajectory towards your career goals or meeting your travel requirements..

Help people get what they need while earning extra income. Shipt is a marketplace that provides fresh produce, household essentials, and more from trusted local stores. There's never been a better time to join Shipt and earn on a flexible schedule.

Your role:


Accept local orders in the Shipt Shopper app
Shop and deliver orders (door drop-off options available)
Deliver a high-quality customer experience

Why choose Shipt?


Extra income: Get paid weekly, keep 100% of tips, and earn up to $22/hr or more.
Help your community: Provide a valuable service and form connections.
Flexible hours: Choose your schedule and work when its best for you.
Safety first: Door drop-off options are available no home entry required.
24/7 support: Our support team is always ready to help.
Free membership: Discover the convenience of same-day delivery for yourself.
Join the family: Meet shoppers through online groups, events, and local meetups.
Earn wherever you are: Shop around home or on the road.

Requirements:


18+ years old
Reliable vehicle (model year 1997 or newer)
Valid car insurance
Current U.S. drivers license
Fresh produce selection skills
Personal insulated cooler bag
Ability to lift 40+ pounds
Smartphone (Android or iPhone)

BE ESSENTIAL 
Residential Staff  
Full time, Part Time and Temporary Positions
Available Immediately 
JRI, a leader is social justice, operates residential programs, where the people we serve live 24-7. This is a challenge, and an opportunity for you to become "essential personnel" as we keep our communities safe during the COVID crisis. If you are healthy and want to help, please join us. 
We have an urgent need for residential staff in Attleboro, Housatonic, Westboro, Tewksbury, Taunton, Framingham, Marlboro, Lowell, Berkley, Dracut, Littleton, Swansea, Lexington, Waltham, and Concord. A variety of schedules and shifts are available. 
Residential staff at JRI work with children, adolescents and adults, facilitating therapeutic and fun recreational activities, maintaining safety and security and working as part of an interdisciplinary team including clinicians, nurses, teachers and residential staff. This is a job where you can make a real difference in the lives of the people we serve. 
We are looking for people who are creative, flexible, innovative and able to work well with others. Previous experience working with children or adolescents is a plus. We provide comprehensive training and support. 
JRI offers competitive pay, excellent benefits and a fun, collaborative work environment where diversity is welcomed and respected. There are opportunities to advance and we offer outstanding educational assistance.
JRI is an equal opportunity employer and is strongly committed to building and maintaining a diverse community. Persons from diverse backgrounds including women, communities of color, the LGBTQ community and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Job Description:
COVID-19 Hring Update: Please note we have paused hiring for this position until further notice. However, we encourage you to submit your application, resume and cover letter. Once recruiting resumes, we will contact those applicants whose skills and experience closely match the requirements of the position.
Berklee College of Music invites nominations and applications for a part-time faculty position in the Voice Department. The ideal candidate will demonstrate significant professional accomplishment, knowledge, and skill in vocal performance across a wide variety of contemporary styles, especially in the Musical Theater genre. They will be committed to excellence in teaching with an acute awareness of vocal health and wellness, and enjoy working in a campus climate that promotes cultural diversity and multicultural understanding. Ranking and compensation is commensurate with professional experience, competencies, and qualifications. The start date for the position is September 1, 2020.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Teach applied voice in both individual private lessons and group vocal ensembles/labs with a special emphasis in the Musical Theater genre.Guide students in the development of efficient vocal technique - serving as a mentor and role modelDevelop customized student strategies for maintaining vocal health and wellness, including physical and vocal warm-ups, and other targeted preventative measuresAcademic advising for studentsMay be asked to contribute to curriculum development, course content, and reviewInvolvement in auditions determining eligibility, juries, and final examsContribute to Voice Department-sponsored special eventsAdditional duties as assigned by the Department Chair(s)

QUALIFICATIONS:

A minimum of 5-years effective teaching experience and curriculum development at the college level preferredA record of significant professional performing experience and/or recordings as a vocalistActive experience of performing and continuing professional developmentExpertise and/or comprehensive knowledge of a wide variety of Musical Theater repertoireDemonstrated experience promoting race and gender equity in American Musical TheaterPiano accompanying skills sufficient to support vocal instruction are requiredDemonstrated interest and experience in teaching Musical Theater repertoireDemonstrated success in teaching vocal pedagogy associated with contemporary musical stylesStrong command of technology and PA systems to support teaching and learningAptitude for embracing cultural diversity in individuals, teaching perspectives, and curriculumExcellent communication and interpersonal skills to excel within a team-oriented departmental cultureMasters of Music (or equivalent professional experience) preferred

APPLICATION MATERIALS:

Electronic applications only.  Please submit the following application materials in PDF or Word format at berklee.edu/jobs. All attachments should be uploaded to the Resume/CV application section.

Letter of application (2-page max)Current resume or curriculum vitaeA statement of your teaching philosophy (1-page max)Letters of recommendation from at least three (3) referencesLinks to websites and/or online resources with representative samples of your performances and teaching

All applications and supporting materials must be received by June 1, 2020. Incomplete applications will not be considered.

DIVERSITY COMMITMENT:

Berklee College of Music is committed to increasing the diversity of the College community and the curriculum. Candidates who can contribute to that goal are encouraged to apply and to identify their strengths in this area.

* Currently enrolled Berklee students may not apply for Staff or Faculty positions.

Applicants who are both interested and qualified should submit the following materials:

• Cover letter that addresses the applicant’s capabilities and experiences.

• A resume or CV.

Currently enrolled Berklee students may not apply for staff or faculty positions.

The above information on this position description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by individuals within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Requirements are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” employment relationship.

External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the Americans With Disabilities Act, must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by management on a case-by-case basis.

Incomplete applications will not be considered. The position will remain open for applications until filled.

Researcher II Humanities

20-Mar-2020

Auto req ID

52072BR

Job Code

RS0056 Researcher II Humanities

Location

USA - MA - Boston

Business Title

Research Associate

Sub-Unit



-----------


Appointment End Date

30-Jun-2021

Salary Grade

056

Time Status

Full-time

Union

00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary

Basic Qualifications

BA/BS with minimum of 2-4 years of related experience required. Advanced degree such as MPH/MPP, related MA, or MD/MBA is preferred.

Additional Qualifications

A strong passion for health care delivery is essential. Experience or training in health care delivery is highly desirable. Experience in a top-tier management consulting firm is desirable.

Evidence of outstanding academic achievement. Evidence of prior high-quality, original academic writing, and background in analysis and interpretation of relevant data, research, news, and literature. Ability to read academic, subject-specific information and write a reasoned and thoughtful analysis, as well as produce a creative interpretation, is a must. Experience with data analysis is desirable; strong skills related to the Microsoft Office Suite are expected. Fluency in English as a primary written and spoken language is required.

The successful candidate will demonstrate strong conceptual ability; high quality of mind; excellent writing skills; the ability to work productively under time pressure; ability to interact successfully with senior leaders; the capacity to work well with others and independently; willingness to travel (the travel expected is modest); and comfort in an academic environment.

Additional Information

This is a full-time term appointment starting this summer (start date flexible) through June 30, 2021, with strong potential for reappointment. The ideal candidate should be willing to commit to work at the Institute for two or more years in order to attain a mastery of the subject.

Applicants should not reach out to Professor Porter directly.

Harvard Business School does not offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity.

Applications will be considered on a rolling basis, a cover letter and resume are required for full consideration. Upon the review of application materials, applicants may be asked to submit a writing sample and transcript(s). All positions will be given a writing exam.

Department

Division of Research and Faculty Development

Pre-Employment Screening

Education, Identity

Job Function

Research

Job-Specific Responsibilities

The Institute for Strategy and Competitiveness (www.isc.hbs.edu) is a joint Institute of Harvard University and Harvard Business School, dedicated to supporting and extending the research pioneered by Professor Porter and disseminating it to scholars and practitioners on a global basis. The Institute is focused on the study of competition and its implications for the strategy of companies and other types of organizations, the competitiveness of nations, regions and cities, and new ways to address social challenges such as health care, environmental impact, corporate social responsibility, and philanthropy.

The Research Associate, based at the ISC and working directly with Professor Porter and team, will focus almost exclusively on Professor Porter’s health care research stream. There may also be some opportunity to work on strategy or economic development depending on the candidate.

Professor Porter’s 2006 book, Redefining Health Care, offers a value-based framework for understanding the problems in health care delivery in the United States and other countries (http://www.hbs.edu/rhc/index.html). A large body of additional research and curriculum development has occurred over the past several years. As a member of Professor Porter’s value-based health care team, the Research Associate will assist Professor Porter in advancing this research, including contributing to research projects in the ISC, and in partnership with outside organizations. The Research Associate is expected to develop case studies and other teaching materials, peer-reviewed publications, and aid in policy and management research. The Research Associate will also assist with developing presentations to domestic and international audiences, and representing Professor Porter to important constituencies.

The Research Associate will assist with the content development and administration of Professor Porter’s health care courses, currently including a week-long intensive seminar for Harvard graduate students and practicing physicians as well as two 3-day Senior Executive programs for C-level representatives of leading health care organizations. The Research Associate will work closely with the ISC’s health care research team and the rest of the ISC research team.

School/Unit

Harvard Business School

jobDetails:
MICRO CENTER is the nation’s leading computer and electronic device big box retailer! Our technology super store has an industry-leading 40,000+ selection of premier computer products and the most knowledgeable staff in the business. Micro Center has been ranked by one of the leading consumer advocacy magazines as a top walk-in store to purchase a PC based on merchandise selection, service and pricing. Work with us and help us on our mission to be the best computer and electronic device store in the world!

We are currently accepting applications for energetic and hardworkingTemporary Retail Associates to assist customers with a variety of needs in our high-volume big box retail store.At this time, we are seeking full-time and part-time temporary associates in a variety of positions, and there may be a possibility for ongoing regular employment at the completion of the temporary assignment. The available positions include retail store greeters, cashiers, sales associates and merchandising/warehouse associates. Descriptions of the various positions available are listed below.

RETAIL STORE GREETER: The greeter should be positioned just inside the front door all hours the store is open for business and will be responsible for the following:

• Greet customers as they enter the store while maintaining the 6-foot separation recommendation as described by the CDC.

• Inform customers of CDC guidelines to maintain the 6-foot separation recommendation from the CDC.

• Inform customers of hand sanitizer stations provided for our associates and customers located throughout the store.

• Offer customers a cart and wipe the handle of the cart with sanitizing wipes prior to giving it to the customer.

• Ask customers who are dropping off their equipment for repair to disinfect their equipment with the provided disinfectant solutions near the service department.

• Other duties as assigned

RETAIL SALES ASSOCIATES:

Greet customers and present credible product solutions based on customers’ needs; build repeat business through consultative solution selling and customer satisfaction.Perform merchandising activities such as processing freight, creating displays and end caps, completing markdowns and price changes and maintaining visual merchandising standards within your Area of Responsibility (AOR).

RETAIL CUSTOMER SERVICE (CASHIER) ASSOCIATES:

Provide superior service when assisting customers at the point of sale/checkout area; build repeat business through customer satisfaction.Process outgoing merchandise by completing credit and cash transactions.Obtain accurate name, address, and email capture of Micro Center customers.

MERCHANDISING/WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATES:

Execute the 18-minute Web Pick-Up processes and assist customers with carryout.Process incoming and outgoing shipments.Assemble floor displays and resets.

EDUCATION& EXPERIENCE:

High school diploma or equivalent.Passion for computers and technology preferable but not required.Ability to communicate professionally, handle multiple customers at a time.Sincere interest in helping customers and driving world-class customer experiencesProfessional appearance and demeanor.Physical requirements: lift up to 50 lbs., stand for prolonged periods of time.Shifts include hours before and after the store is open to the public and may also include mornings, nights, weekends and holidays.Previous experience relative to the position of interest is preferred but not required.

OUR GROWTH OPPORTUNITIES:

At Micro Center, we empower our employees to set their sights high and blaze their own trails. This is a place where your future success and growth are truly a result of your own efforts and achievements. Our teams are made up of motivated individuals who work hard to advance their careers. Join our team and see how hard work, loyalty, competitive spirit and unwavering commitment to the customer can take you and your career to new places.

BENEFITS& OTHER INFORMATION:

Micro Center offers competitive pay and an employee discount on merchandise for seasonal associates. Micro Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pre-employment criminal background and substance abuse screening.

Job Description

Kelly Services is looking for Store Clerks and Baggers for Immediate hire in the Massachusetts area! Several shifts are available and no experience is required!

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: - Work in a courteous manner in a fast paced multi functional environment alone or with other people. - Assist in increasing sales by utilizing the five steps of retail selling - Connect with the customer; qualify the customer; present solutions; closing the sale and create a customer for life. - Reading and completing an assignment sheet upon which the amount of product stocked each shift is recorded by the clerk. Other duties performed must be recorded as well. - Load and unload product weighing up to 60 lbs. from pallets stacked to a height of 6 feet. - Pull pallets weighing several hundred pounds from trailers into backroom areas and/or onto sales floor. - Lift and load 5-60 lb cases onto stock carts and push or pull large carts to stocking area. - Open boxes and other containers with the use of a box cutter when appropriate. - Manually remove product from cartons and replenish Grocery shelves and/or refrigerated cases with product on a continuous basis. The continuous stocking of shelves requires significant repetitive motion as well as reaching above the shoulders for upper shelves and bending and/or stooping to reach lower shelves. - Must work quickly and carefully while stocking items at a reasonable expectancy (R/E). - Visually identify product and read display signs including shelf tags. - Break down boxes (flatten) and transport to storage area.



Requirements



Stores are usually open 7 days a week. - Full time associates usually work 40 hours a week. - Grocery clerk requires the performance of repetitive tasks. - Grocery clerk requires significant lifting and carrying of product. - Retail store conditions are generally dry with moderate temperature. - Grocery back room conditions are generally moderate. - Cooler conditions may be wet or dry, and usually cold. - Freezer conditions are usually very cold. - Associates in the Grocery are usually scheduled according to peak stocking times.




Highlights

Shifts:

8am-4:30p.m;

12:00-8:30p.m.,

3:30p.m.-12:00a.m

Schedule options

Sunday through Thursday

Monday through Friday

Thursday through Monday

GPAC: Top Commercial Drywall Recruiting Firm in the Nation

I am searching with a reputable, family-friendly Commercial Drywall Contractor for a skilled Senior level Estimator.

The company has been experiencing growth in both work and the size of jobs. They have a need for a skilled estimator to step in and run a team of estimators.

The contractor is running over $25 Million in work annually, & they aren't looking to stop there. Even amongst the Corona fear that is happening, they are expanding.

They have a family first priority and a strong continued plan for growth with their backlog of work. They have built their culture around hard work, competition in the Boston market.

Their projects orbit around hospitals, medical care facilities, institutional, schools, and office projects.

Requirements: 8+ years of experience in estimating and management of diverse, metal stud, commercial drywall projects, OST and Quick Bid estimating software background.

If you have any questions about this position email derek.rintala@gogpac.com or give Derek Rintala a call at (605)-809-8572

All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States for the past 30 years. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Knoq is building a world where neighbors help neighbors. Our technology recruits, trains and guides neighborhood representatives (Knoqers) to go out into their own neighborhoods and educate people about products and services that can make their lives better. Our platform has been used by Google Fiber, NRG, Inspire Energy, Fluent Home Security and many other direct-to-home brands. We are growing 500% YoY and are backed by Haystack VC, Initialized, Liquid2, Fathom Capital and Background Capital.

Right now, we can't connect with our neighbors the way we normally do, but we're still committed to helping our neighbors in need. To do that, we are looking for willing and able neighborhood representatives who are passionate about helping their community during COVID-19. We have partnered with the Greater Boston Food Bank, Food Equality Initiative, Kroger, United Way of Utha and other organizations to safely bring food and other essential items to people in Boston, Kansas City and Salt Lake City. As a Knoq Cares representative, you will shop for groceries, deliver essential items, and do anything else to serve our communities during the COVID-19 crisis.

What you'll do


Supplement shifts in warehouses and grocery stores that are overtaxed
Safely support food and essential item delivery needs of food banks and grocery stores
Learn the Knoq app and sales methodology through training and mentorship
Communicate with Knoq team and partners
Once the crisis is over, you will have an opportunity to become a neighborhood representative, selling a variety of products to your neighbors and exponentially accelerating your earnings

Who you are:


2+ years of experience in customer service, restaurant, retail, hospitality or sales
Driven, hardworking and competitive
Reliable
Superior communication skills
Ability to work evenings and weekends
Able to be on call/flexible with schedules and respond quickly

Pay:

$15.00 per hour and Hero Bonus of $5 per hour until June 1st

Hourly Commitments:

We have both part time and full time opportunities. Full time associates are eligible for health benefits.


Part time: 20 hrs per week
Full time: 30- 40 hrs per week

Requirements:


Candidates must be willing to submit to a criminal history check

Health Care Editor (Volunteer) - COVID-19

This is a TIME-SENSITIVE query for skilled, experienced health reporters with superb sources who can help us cover COVID-19. You will be at the heart of covering the worlds top story right now!

*Note: The following is an opportunity for flexible, part-time, volunteer work. Please DO NOT APPLY if you are only looking for paid employment.* This is a remote-from-home position.

Are you an experienced journalist who is passionate about making a difference? Do you have broad knowledge related to health care and the health care industry, including clinical, research, and, especially, policy aspects as may relate to the coronavirus? Are you excited about the opportunity to work with smart and talented individuals committed to producing great content in the public interest? Can you commit a minimum of 10 hours a week, working remotely on your own schedule with our far-flung, diverse team?

Check out WhoWhatWhy.org. Youll quickly see that were a credible solution to the raging debate over whether the news is fake or not, with agenda-free research and bracingly fresh analysis. Not left-wing, not right-wing, not consensus-seeking. We just want the truth -- whatever it is.

We have thought long and hard about what limits journalisms ability to effect positive change in the public interest, and we see two factors that dominate the landscape: (1) Commercial entities overly concerned with meeting financial goals and filling eyeball quotas while keeping up with the rest of the pack, thereby ensuring a sameness and superficiality to the coverage (2) Ideologically driven outfits that cater to a specific mindset and dare not reveal things that would upset their readers or force them to reconsider their values.

At WhoWhatWhy, we go at each story with an open mind, boundless curiosity, and a willingness to dig deep and ask hard questions even when were told not to. Nothing is going to stand in our way when it comes to discovering what is going on beneath the surface, and why. Call it naive to believe such fearlessness possible, but we think its the essence of true journalism.

And because were straight to the point, we make clear that were looking for volunteers skilled volunteers. Yes, were a nonprofit that wasnt funded by a zillionaire. Yes, we decline to accept corporate ads. Yes, we have a tiny budget right now and simply don't have the ability to pay many people very much.

Responsibilities

Help develop and implement a strategy to cover COVID-19Recruit and supervise reportersIdentify sourcesOversee story editing and edit stories

Qualifications

Extensive journalistic experienceBroad familiarity with health care issues -- clinical, research, and especially policy An extensive network of contacts and sourcesAt least two years experience editingThe ability to delegate tasks and manage and motivate othersThe patience to monitor multiple individuals, projects and processes Collaborative spirit and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment

Perks

Channel your passion in a stimulating environmentLearn the nuts and bolts of nonprofit operations in an up-and-coming organizationDevelop new skills and gain valuable experience that can enhance your professional trajectoryDo amazing work on a flexible, part-time basisHave fun while you make a differenceYou will be seen!

Expectations

You will work remotely and on your own schedule, though we require a minimum commitment of 10-15 hours a week (Doing more is not discouraged!). Because our staff is spread throughout the world, we communicate mostly through slack, email, and a few conference calls. All volunteers are required to respond to slack conversations and emails on a frequent basis. If you possess a high level of self-motivation, work well independently but also have strong collaboration skills and enjoy the opportunity to partner with other senior leaders, and can commit quality time per week on a regular basis to help achieve team goals, wed like to hear from you.

To Apply

We will not review applications that appear to be mass submissions. To apply, send your resume and customized cover letter that shows that you have studied and thought about what we do at WhoWhatWhy and explains why you are a good fit for this position. If there is no option to attach a cover letter, please send a cover letter to hr@whowhatwhy.org. You should also confirm your understanding that this is a volunteer position. Thank you!

A brief update on Covid-19 (coronavirus)Simply Business is well prepared to deal with unprecedented events. We’re an agile business by nature – and our hiring and interview process is no exception. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, some parts of our hiring process may take a little longer than usual. Please bear with us, and rest assured that we're happy to hear from you and receive your application.If it looks like you could be a good fit for the role, we’ll ask you to interview on Zoom – you’ll need WiFi and a laptop, or a 4G-enabled smartphone. If you don’t have access to either of these, or you need support with your application, get in touch with us at careers@simplybusiness.co.uk. Similarly, please email us if you’re not well, you’re self-isolating, or if you want to pause your application for a bit – we’ll be happy to keep you updated on future opportunities like the one below.Simply Business is more than our name. It's how we approach insurance: Make it clear. Make it simple. Make it affordable. By combining exceptional talent, technology, data, and knowledge, Simply Business is the go-to online insurance brokerage that protects small businesses and the entrepreneurs who work hard to build them. We want team members who have the drive to challenge boundaries. If you’re smart and passionate about delivering brilliant customer experiences, we’d love to hear from you.We need a Business Development Manager to join our growing Commercial team. Reporting to the Vice President of Insurance Panel, this position will play a pivotal role in enabling business success by identifying, building, and executing relationships with commercial insurance carriers. The Commercial team is responsible for building a panel of insurance carriers and identifying partnerships that lead to impactful business outcomes for Simply Business, the partner, and our customers.As a Business Development Manager you will:Work closely with the VP of Insurance Panel to identify target insurance carriers to engage withHave accountability for carrier panel development and expansionShare SB value proposition to new potential carriersProbe carrier pain points and identify unique Simply Business solutions to address those pain points in alignment with SB strategic initiative(s)Negotiate contract terms with insurance carrier panel members, including compensationCommunicate onboarding expectations internally and externally while providing oversight of carrier onboarding activitiesAttend and represent SB at industry eventsCommunicate carrier panel pipeline development updates to SB senior leadershipTravel up to 30% of timeWhat we are looking for:5+ years of experience with commercial insurance placement in preferably both the admitted and non-admitted market A deep level of industry expertise and subject matter expertise, preferably as an Agent or Broker with non-admitted experienceDemonstrated experience of identifying, building effective relationships, and ultimately executing agreements of varying types and complexity, with excellent deal negotiation and commercial structuring skillsA self-starter with the ability to manage and prioritize your own workload and pipeline to the needs of the business, with effective communication skillsA highly confident relationship builder with the natural ability to engage, build relationships and networks, and understand the needs of prospective partnersExcellent communication skills and experience delivering compelling pitches, presentations, and proposals based on business and potential partners needs The ability to challenge us! We want people who can come in and shape the future of this business and not be afraid to raise questions and help us improveWhat are the benefits?Here are some of the great benefits and perks that come from being a Simply Business employee:• A salary that reflects your experience, our pay policy, and the market we’re in from your first day• Group plan for medical, dental, and prescription drug coverage• Short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance coverage• Participation in the Company’s bonus program• Participation in 401(k) plan with a 3% employer match• Commuter benefits to help cut down on commuting costs• 25 days of vacation time plus 10 company holidays• Flexible working hours and working from home• Annual company trip, regular outings, and volunteer opportunities • An awesome WeWork office with cold brew coffee and other beverages on tap, local pop-up events, and more As a company, we pride ourselves on inclusion in the workplace. Simply Business is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Want more info on working at Simply Business? Check out our careers page: https://www.simplybusiness.com/careers/

EEO Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Summary

Reporting to the Executive Dean for Administration, the Harvard Medical School (HMS) Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) is responsible for developing and executing human resources strategy in support of the school’s strategic plan and direction. This person will specifically lead in the areas of talent management, employee relations, compensation, HRIS and analytics, HR compliance, change management, organizational and performance management, and learning and development. The CHRO provides strategic leadership by driving a culture that is aligned with HMS vision and mission.

The position of CHRO represents an exciting opportunity to be a key member of the senior leadership team and impact the human capital, as well as the future, of the School. The ideal candidate will be a highly experienced executive with a strong working knowledge of human resources principles and programs and an effective leader with solid interpersonal and communication skills. The CHRO will be engaged, confident, and innovative, and possess high energy and integrity. In addition, they will possess strategic- thinking abilities and have an exceptional capacity to build collaborative relationships with staff and faculty at all levels. Given a variety of current initiatives currently underway, the CHRO will serve as one of several transformational change agents within the HMS leadership team.

execution of immunoassays, extensive experience with modern immunoassay design and optimization, recombinant proteins, protein purification, protein labeling and protein modification strategies. Educational background: BS Degree in Biochemistry, Biophysics, Structural Biology etc.

Overview

Our client is focused on developing an innovative photonics technology for biomedical diagnostics and drug development. Our cutting-edge technology will enable new frontiers of medical research for ultrahigh-sensitivity detection of single molecules in low volume liquid biopsy samples.

Responsibilities:



	Development of immunoassays for biofluids and cell-based samples.

Optimization of traditional and novel assay parameters to improve sensitivity, specificity, and throughput of detection. Development of robust immunoassay protocols and scientific interpretations of measurement results.

Creation of documents for new protocols, designs, and IP filings. 

General Qualifications:



	BS degree in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Biophysics, Structural Biology or related disciplines. 2+ years of hands-on experience in biology assay development, in-depth experience in immunoassays including ELISA, western blot, dot blot, bead-based assays, fluorescent assays and label-free assays required.

2+ years of hands-on experience in protein purification and protein labeling techniques, solid knowledge in antibody technologies required.

Preferred Qualifications:



	Previous research expertise in the field of immunology

Experience with protein microarrays. Experience in using miniature devices (including lab-on-a-chip systems) to perform assays. Experience in microscopy.

Experience with laboratory automation including liquid handling, plate readers, plate washers, and incubators. Experience in drug development processes is preferred.

Scientist I

11-Mar-2020

Auto req ID

51995BR

Job Code

RS0158 Scientist I

Location

USA - MA - Boston

Business Title

Senior Staff Scientist

Sub-Unit

Wyss Institute

Salary Grade

058

Time Status

Full-time

Union

00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary

Basic Qualifications

Master’s degree in biological or medical science with at least 6 years of related experience. Advanced education may count towards years of experience.

Additional Qualifications

Previous post-graduate industrial experience with a focus on product development is strongly preferred.

PhD in biological or medical science is strongly preferred.

Highly desirable additions include: post-doctoral training; knowledge of and experience with endothelial biology and IPS technology, antibody engineering, microfluidic assays, proteomics, transcriptomics/RNA-Seq, and target selection and validation. Extensive experience with mammalian cell culture is required. Expertise or experience with some or all of: antibody discovery and functional assays, cell-based qPCR/TaqMan, ELISA, Western blot, enzymatic assays, imaging, flow cytometry, and mouse experiments in strongly preferred. Ability to work well independently and supervise and train research associates, interns and students is essential, as is the ability to collaborate with a multidisciplinary group in a matrix organization, using influence rather than authority over colleagues. Excellent written and oral communication skills are essential. The candidate should be highly motivated, detail-oriented, organized.

Additional InformationThe mission of the Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University is to transform human healthcare and the environment by emulating the way nature builds. Developed as an alliance between Harvard and other premier academic and clinical partner institutions, Institute faculty and staff collaborate in high-risk, fundamental research and science-driven technology development. A major focus of the Institute is to translate the technologies developed by its faculty and staff into commercial products and therapies through collaborations with clinical investigators and establishment of corporate alliances and launching startup companies. For more information, visit: http://wyss.harvard.edu/.

Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:

Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.Retirement: University-funded retirement plan contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.


Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.

Department

Wyss Institute

Pre-Employment Screening

Education, Identity

Schedule

Monday through Friday, 9am - 5pm

Job Function

Research

Job-Specific Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be responsible for project design and leadership, including optimization and execution of antibody transport assays in our primary and iPSC-derived cell culture-based human BBB models, such as the trans-well and microfluidic BBB-Chip assays. In this capacity, the scientist will be responsible for advancing testing and prioritization of antibody hits and leads into candidates for advancement to in vivo testing. The scientist will oversee and play a hands-on role in the development and validation of various in-vitro, cell-based and in vivo assays. The candidate will also contribute to antibody target discovery efforts including preparing cells for proteomics and transcriptomics experiments. The candidate will be expected to work independently under the supervision of senior staff and faculty to design experiments, learn new skills, troubleshoot, and to take scientific leadership of significant parts of the project. The candidate will direct and mentor junior staff to clearly defined product development goals and end-user needs. They will be responsible for managing performance as well as advocating and developing junior staff. They should demonstrate an advanced understanding of phase appropriate product development milestones in accordance with technical and commercialization goals. They will work closely with Business Development and Office of Technology Development to establish commercial opportunities, licensing structures and start-up strategies. In addition, the candidate must function well in a team-oriented environment with other scientists and staff at the Institute as well as external collaborators.

School/Unit

Harvard Medical School

EEO Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Summary

The Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University seeks an enthusiastic Senior Staff Scientist to join the Institute’s Brain Targeting Program to focus on the antibody shuttle research and development. This position is an exciting opportunity to combine cutting edge, hands-on research with the strategic considerations of technology translation and product development.

The Institute’s Brain Targeting Program is using novel human in vitro models of the blood brain barrier (BBB) to develop improved methods of transporting therapeutics and diagnostics across the BBB into the CNS (https://wyss.harvard.edu/technology/brain-targeting-shuttles-for-drug-delivery-and-diagnostics/). It’s core projects at present include a target discovery effort directed to identifying proteins on the BBB endothelial cell surface that are highly expressed and are enriched compared to endothelial cells from other organs. These proteins will be evaluated for their potential to transport cargoes across the BBB by one of several mechanisms, and then tested to validate and prioritize them for generation of antibody shuttles that bind to them. We are currently developing novel antibody shuttles directed against several known Ab shuttle targets. These will be tested in the human in vitro transwell and BBB-Chip assays, and eventually in humanized mouse models. The Wyss team is collaborating with several biopharmaceutical companies and other academic institutions to advance the BBB antibody shuttle program. We are also pursuing multiple other exploratory projects including an Alzheimer’s-on-Chip model, connections between the brain and the gut, and testing of small molecule BBB shuttles. The Brain Targeting Program is part of the Ingber lab’s Bioinspired Therapeutics and Diagnostics platform, which includes more than 20 Organ-on-Chip models and related projects. The group is collaborative and collegial and has extensive interactions between projects, people and institutions.

jobDetails:
Atrium is a full-service talent management firm, focused on providing contingent workforce solutions. Atrium expertise includes Temporary and Direct Hire Staffing, Payrolling Services, Independent Contractor Compliance, Managed Service Provider (MSP) Programs and Intern Program Design. We’re looking for passionate and motivated individual that is excited to grow their career with a modern consulting and talent acquisition firm.Opportunity:Atrium partners with a global pharmaceutical client located in Waltham, MA and is currently developing a specialized MSP program. We’re looking for passionate and motivated onsite Program Manager, Senior Recruiter that is excited to grow their career with an evolving staffing and consulting firm.

Salary:Competitive compensation and benefitsJob Responsibilities of the Program Manager, Senior Recruiter:



Act as an Atrium Program Manager and onsite client liaison as part of Atrium MSP program
 Recruit within client applicant tracking system and match qualified applicants against requisitions
 Lead Staffing Supplier relationships within the Program in a manner that yields partnership and extraordinary service delivery
 Conduct thorough intake calls with managers to ascertain specific soft skills and additional preferences to ensure appropriate resumes are screened and presented
 Model the highest levels of integrity and deliver ‘white glove’ service to support client and applicants
 Develop strong, cross-functional Atrium and client relationships; maintain communication with leadership, sponsors (TA/HR/Finance), managers and candidates
 Promote program adoption, compliance, communications, onboarding and other operations
 Respond to manager and applicant inquiries in an efficient and timely manner
 Diagnose/resolve raised client concerns in a timely manner, together with leadership as needed
 Maintain and demonstrate knowledge of client’s industry, products and markets; establish on-site awareness of business developments
 Attend regular status meetings with both internal Atrium team and client to drive Program goals and requirements
 The Program Manager, Senior Recruiter will recommend continuous program and workflow improvements
 Partner with client to design and administer surveys to be issued to managers, candidates and suppliers and gather valuable recruitment and MSP program feedback
 Participate in the development of presentations and relevant materials, i.e.: Quarterly Business Reports


Minimum Qualifications of the Program Manager, Senior Recruiter:



Minimum 5 years of dynamically responsible work experience as an account manager
 Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with the internal client and Atrium program team
 Exposure to HR technology platforms
 Advanced computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, etc.)
 Ability to work independently and also excel in a team environment
 Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, organizational, social and motivational skills


Education Requirements:





 Bachelor’s Degree

Machine learning is eating the world. At PathAI, we're applying it in amazing ways to pathology, healthcare, and detecting cancer and other diseases. We're applying our work to drug development, the clinical space, and as a global health initiative. For us, it's early dayswe have some unique and important design challenges to solve, and recognize that design and UX will be crucial to everything we're doing.

We're looking for an experienced product designer to join our team and help solve some of these challenges. If you're the right candidate, you'll have opportunities to use all your design skills:


Dive into research mode, working with our customers and partners to inform decisions and test our work
Sweat the interaction details, making sure our interface is efficient and accurate, and clearly shows our data and insights
Pull together prototypes, which you'll use for testing and for informing implementation
Articulate complex ideas, both verbally and in writing, to build a shared understanding and drive decisions
Get a handle on constraints, some of which are medical, some regulatory, without sacrificing a great experience
Make it beautiful, since attractive things often work better too
Understand the technologiesand at least a slice of the researchthat brings it all together
It's not always easy, but it's powerful, important, and rewarding work you'll be doing every day


RequirementsGreat designers come in all shapes and sizes, but to be successful in this role with us, you'll at least need:


Experience. You've been around the block a more than a couple times with two or more years of work in this field
A bachelor's degree, preferably in a related field like HCI, CS, graphic design, industrial design, or social sciences like sociology and psychology
A portfolio of work demonstrating your skills on at least a couple of previous projects.
An insatiable intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn quickly in a complex space.



BenefitsFor the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. We have a strong benefits package, including heavily-subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you in peak design-thinking shape. They're rounded out by:


Flexible work hours
Three weeks of paid leave, two weeks of sick leave, plus holidays, and extended leave
Convertible sit-stand desks
Your choice of computer equipment (as long as it's Mac)
Free lunch on Fridays
Fun and healthy sustenance, currently including a wide array of healthyand unhealthysnacks, cold brew coffee, and green tea on tap.
Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll enjoy spending the day with.

jobDetails:
Machine learning is eating the world. At PathAI, we're applying it in amazing ways to pathology, healthcare, and detecting cancer and other diseases. We're applying our work to drug development, the clinical space, and as a global health initiative.

For us, it's early days a fast-growing, in-demand business and the need for a security team that helps keep us quick and nimble while protecting the sensitive customer and patient data we handle.

We're looking for a security engineer to join our team and help us continue to move both fast and safely so we can have the most impact on the outcomes of patients facing serious diseases. We want a security team that builds automated tools and pipelines to help make security and compliance here at PathAI easy, instant, and omnipresent. If you're the right candidate, you'll be part of the team in no time:


Contribute to the design, build, and maintenance of PathAI's security architecture and infrastructure.
Lead and conduct research into vulnerabilities that affect networks, servers, instances, and containers across multiple products and environments.
Model threats that could impact our AWS/cloud and data center environments, and practically apply principles, best practices, and relevant standards.
Build monitoring systems, instrument containers, and scan networks.
Support risk management and compliance activities, building tools and infrastructure in code so we can spend less time producing documentation and evidence.
Work with product engineers and product managers, when appropriate, to mitigate discovered risks and threats, and evangelize best practices and security tooling.
Value automation of processes, helping security tooling to be transparent and ubiquitous throughout the PathAI technology stack.

Requirements:

Our employees come in all shapes and sizes, but to be successful in this role with us, you'll at least need:


Experience. This role will require at least 2-4 years experience working in the software development industry as an engineer with responsibilities relating to both security and DevOps.
Exposure. You shouldn't be a newcomer to the key components in our stack. Web technologies, Python, AWS, Linux, containers (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD pipelines should be a part of your repertoire. You don't need to be an expert in everything, but you should have been around the block once or twice.
Education. Generally, a bachelor's degree in a relevant field is really helpful in working with our team on this kind of work. But feel free to convince us if you're the exception.
Tenacity. We're doing some big things, and we'll find some roadblocks along the way, big and small. A big part of this role is keeping an even keel and finding the route through or around the obstacles.
An insatiable intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn quickly in a complex space.

Benefits:

For the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. We have a strong benefits package, including heavily-subsidized health, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you in peak shape. It's rounded out by:


Flexible work hours
Three weeks of paid leave per year, plus holidays and extended leave
Convertible sit-stand desks
Your choice of computer equipment
Free lunch on Tuesdays and Fridays
Snacks and drinks in the office which currently include a mountain of Milano cookies and cold brew coffee and green tea on tap.

Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll enjoy spending the day with.

2nd Shift Laboratory TechnologistWaltham MA

Contract-to-Hire Opportunity

Shift: 2PM-12AM (Tuesday-Friday, 10-hour shifts) with rotating weekends

Training: 8AM to 4:30PM (Monday-Friday) for 6-8 weeks

Kelly Scientific Resources has an excellent entry-level 3rd shift opportunity for those looking to get into a biology/microbiology laboratory setting. Specifically, this is a great opportunity for those interested in the medical/clinical field. Join a world leader in the food, environmental, and pharmaceutical industry in this clinical diagnostic testing setting!

Laboratory Technologist responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:



	Following prescribed procedures, performing any of the tests within any of the laboratory specialties. Calculating the results of the tests performed in necessary.

Operating, calibrating, conducting performance checks, and maintaining any laboratory analyzers or equipment.

Recognizing and correcting basic analyzer malfunctions. Notifying management personnel when appropriate.

Preparing reagents or media from a prescribed procedure.

Evaluating media, reagents, and calibrators according to established criteria.

Conducting established quality control procedures on analytical tests, equipment, reagents, media, and products. Evaluating results of quality control and implements corrective action when indicated.

Determining performance specifications for new methods.

Confirming and verifying results through knowledge of techniques, principles, and analyzers.

Monitoring quality assurance/continuous improvement programs.

Monitoring safety programs in compliance with laboratory regulations.

Utilizes laboratory information systems or other methods to accurately and effectively report patient results.

Writing laboratory procedures conforming to standardized format.

Reporting test results conforming to established procedures.

The ideal candidate would possess:



	This laboratory carefully maintains all hazardous materials. All employees must abide by the company’s Safety and Exposure procedures. This includes using the provided safety clothing and equipment.

For a list of potential chemical hazards, see appropriate MSDS sheet.

Knowledge of the principles, methods, materials, equipment, and techniques of medical technology.

Knowledge of the principles of chemistry, biology, and bacteriology as related to medical technology.

Some knowledge of recent developments in the field of medical technology.

Ability to instruct subordinate technologist in areas of medical laboratory testing.

Ability to perform assigned tasks according to prescribed procedures and to make accurate observations and records of tests results.

Skill in the use of medical laboratory equipment.

Analytical thinking and communication skills.

Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills

Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail

Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude

Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies

Basic Minimum Qualifications:



	Bachelor’s degree in a chemical, physical, biological or clinical laboratory science, or medical technology from an accredited institution.

Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship

Job Description:

 With the news of COVID19 spreading, Aquent is committed to ensuring the safety and well being of our employees. This includes providing technology to support video interviews, resources and support for employees to work from home successfully, and fully covered healthcare for eligible employees. 

Our major healthcare client is looking for an Information Architect/Content Strategist to provide positive user experience by planning and designing the information structure for websites and web applications. This position focuses on the target audience, the technologies that are used to create the sites and the actual information on the site. This Information Architect will organize information and content and design strategies using data from usability testing on how users interact with a company’s communications systems.

In this role, the Information Architect must be able to translate user behavior into media structure, craft interactive experiences, edit and write content, produce workflow diagrams and other production materials, as well as organize information into site maps, to name few job duties. They also must be able to coordinate with Web Producers and creative and production departments to implement their strategies. An understanding of web production software, such as Visio, Dreamweaver, Office and Sketch is required.

A degree in information technology, MIS or Engineering is generally preferred for the Information Architect position. A strong portfolio is also considered beneficial.

This is a full time 3rd shift 40 hour/week position. 4 ten hour shifts.NOTE: Overnight Shift shifts pay an additional $4.00 shift differentialToday, March 18th we are hiring. Angell has an opening on evening shift in our Emergency/CCU department for a Certified Veterinary Technician. This is an essential role in the daily operations our fast paced ER Services Department which is currently open to Emergency and Emergent patients. This position qualifies for a $2,000 sign on bonus for new hire Certified Veterinary Technicians.Angell, founded in 1915, is recognized internationally as a leader in animal medicine and has the reputation as one of the finest veterinary teaching hospitals in North America. Angell serves the greater Boston and scenic New England area as a primary care facility, a 24-hour emergency hospital, and as a tertiary referral center. We offered the very first veterinary internship in the world beginning in 1941, running continuously to present day. Angell was instrumental in establishing specialty veterinary medicine. Our hospital has a long history of providing training not only to veterinary interns and residents but also to veterinary students and the veterinary community at large.Consider working at our non-profit hospital with State-of-the-art equipment, using your advanced skills in our CCU. Our Technicians are proficient in;-Wound Vac maintenance in post-operative patients-Blood transfusions including auto-transfusions, emergency blood donations for patients-Tracheostomy tube (temporary and permanent) care/maintenance-Ventilator patient care-Continuous Closed Chest Drainage Systems-Chest tube care/maintenance-Central line placement-Urinary catheter placement, care/maintenance-Anesthesia monitoring for minor emergency procedures-Nasal oxygen cannula placement and management-Assisting with thoracentesis, abdominocentesis, pericardiocentesis-Assisting with hemodialysis patient care-Exotics care-Arterial blood sampling and catheters-Management of multiple types of feeding tubes including nasogastric, nasoesophageal, esophageal, and PEG tubes-Total Parenteral Nutrition (TPN) and Partial Parenteral Nutrition (PPN)Working at one of the most acclaimed veterinary practices in the country, caring for approximately 90,000 animals per year you will find our CCU fast paced and challenging working alongside our compassion and professional CCU team. At Angell we offer full time hours (40 per week) and additional pay for overtime worked, competitive pay and benefits package, free on-site Boston parking, and employee discounts for pet health care.The MSPCA-Angell is a challenging and progressive environment where teamwork and camaraderie is a priority. If this sounds like an environment you would enjoy, apply today.RequirementsAdvanced• Minimum 2 years current experience as a technician is required.
• Minimum of 6 months ECC experience is required.
• VTS certification preferred and encouraged to join our 6+ VTS(ECC) technicians

To be hired as a technician, you must be a Certified/Licensed Veterinary Technician (CVT)

Company Description
Kala is a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery, development and commercialization of innovative therapies for diseases of the eye. Kala has applied its AMPPLIFYTM mucus penetrating particle Drug Delivery Technology to a corticosteroid, loteprednol etabonate (LE), designed for ocular applications, resulting in the January 2019 launch of INVELTYS® (loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic suspension) 1% and its investigational product candidate, EYSUVIS TM (loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic suspension) 0.25%, which is being studied for the temporary relief of the signs and symptoms of dry eye disease.

Job Description Digital will play an important role in supporting customer experiences in our new Health Hub format, scaling to 1,500 locations over the next two years. HealthHUB locations offer a broad range of health care services, wellness products, trusted advice, and personalized care, with the ease of walking right into a local CVS Pharmacy. Digital experiences will support new in-store offerings and services by making them easy to find, by enabling customers to research and schedule online, and by enabling customers to stay connected to their care providers. The Advisor / Product Owner (PO) is a member of the Agile Product Team responsible for defining Stories and prioritizing the Team Backlog. This is an instrumental role in driving day to day development for a digital program that generates mulit-million dollar business value to the organization and touches millions of consumers. Responsible for streamlining the execution of team priorities while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the features / components for the team. The PO has a significant role in quality control and is the only team member empowered to accept stories as done. This PO role will support the Digital Reach agile product team(s) This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside the local team, including working with Product Management, who is responsible for the Program Backlog, to prepare for the Program Increment (PI) Planning meeting. User Story Development - Works with product management and stakeholders to align on business value, problem statements, and customer pain points that are strategic priorities for CVS Health - Provides subject matter expertise explaining product vision and user stories to the team to ensure requirements are understood and customer value is delivered - Collaborates with development team to elaborate and define technical learnings into refined and prioritized backlog items that align to Iteration Objectives - Responsible for defining and prioritizing stories that will increase velocity and quality of the program - Responsible for assuring a level of quality has been achieved by validating that the Story meets acceptance criteria and has met acceptance tests. Approves stories as complete. - Responsible to update product management on Story status to align on delivery expectations Team Backlog Ownership/Prioritization - Responsible for building, prioritizing, monitoring/editing, and maintaining the flow of Team Backlog to ensure the delivery of the customer satisfaction and multi-million dollar business value - Sets the runway for early business value and customer impact by determining sequencing of sprint planning - Leads the team in identifying dependencies and tradeoffs as well as problem solving risks that may appear in the Team Backlog Program Increment Planning - Partner with Product Management, who is responsible for the Program Backlog, to assist in preparing for the Program Increment (PI) Planning meeting - Identify the potential enablers and spikes for discussion in the Program Increment - Drafts the teams objectives and defines features for the Program Increment session - Collaborates with the team to produce the PI system demo and the Product Owner presents it to program stakeholders - Maintain Conceptual and Technical Integrity of Features/Components - Partner with design function to consider usability testing and end-user feedback to ensure product will address and resolve user pain points - Provide architecture and development teams sufficiently detailed feedback on user stories and product vision to ensure the team maintains the technical integrity of features / functionality Required Qualifications 3+ years required experience as Product Owner, Business Analyst, Project Manager, Consulting, IT, or related field. Previous experience in agile product development helpful Preferred Qualifications 3+ years required experience as Product Owner, Business Analyst, Project Manager, Consulting, IT, or related field. Previous experience in agile product development helpful. 5+ years preferred Strong critical thinker who makes balanced, insightful decisions using solutions based thinking in problem solving, asking probing questions and looking for underlying issues Ability to effectively work on teams within a highly collaborative environment Strong negotiation, organizational, management, analytical and people skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors) Ability to maintain working relationships with all levels of the organization Broad understanding of core programming, systems architecture, and date science concepts Experience in corporate retail or loyalty program experience preferred. Digital Reach an Ad Tech a plus. Familiarity with agile processes, such as scrum, Kanban, and/or the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) Education Bachelors Degree Business Overview Its a new day in health care. Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nations premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, were pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, youll be at the center of it all. At CVS Health, we work every day to help people on their path to better health. Never has it been more important for us to deliver on our purpose to our valued customers, patients, members, and employees. With a presence in communities across the country, CVS Health colleagues are and will continue to be a critical piece of the countrys health care solution.
