jobDetails: Future Chefs (www.futurechefs.net) prepares high-school aged teens for quality employment and postsecondary opportunities in the culinary field and elsewhere and supports them in developing broad-based transferable skills necessary for career success. With a primary focus on youth development, Future Chefs provides culinary and soft skills training and authentic hands-on experience, working with food professionals in some of Boston’s high performing restaurants and food businesses. Aspiring cooks learn in an environment that promotes a growth mindset, personal responsibility and well-being. Future Chefs’ model is based on the belief that every student is unique, flourishes in settings that provide high expectations, opportunities to grow, and caring supportive relationships. Future Chefs is a fiscally sponsored project of TSNE MissionWorks (www.tsne.org).The Temporary Culinary Arts Instructor will work collaboratively with the Future Chefs Program Team to implement curriculum for FC Prepares programming during the winter and spring of 2019- 2020. FC Prepares is a 7 week program primarily aimed at high school sophomores, which Future Chefs offers both at our own facility and also offsite at partner school locations. The position will include supervising and leading both kitchen and classroom oriented activities and tracking student progress through program-wide evaluation activities. The position will involve some recruitment with the Future Chefs Student Services team, planning and prep for once a week after school classes, and being the lead instructor for these sessions. This position could transition into permanent and/or full-time employment with Future Chefs. Who You Are You have done culinary work in a professional setting and are seeking to work in a youth-centric organization where you can share your passion for cooking and help teens and young adults develop they skills they need to succeed in life after high school. You are genuinely interested in young people’s progress, have a passion for food to share with them and are committed to working with low income urban youth. You are highly organized and a positive team player who is motivated by new challenges and a fast-paced work environment. You are able to model patience, professionalism, optimism and integrity for this group of young people. Essential Job FunctionsThe Temporary Culinary Arts Instructor will work with Future Chefs’ Work-Based Learning Leader and the Student Services Team to:Work with the Future Chefs Program staff to recruit, plan and deliver a FC Prepares course for up to 15 sophomores and juniors in winter and spring of 2019-20, as a gateway to those students enrolling in the FC Delivers program in the Fall of 2020.Ensure that data related to outcomes measurement is collected and entered on schedule.Plan and execute class materials and document class outcomes. Maintain regular student and program evaluation including data collection, data input, and data analysis alongside program staff.Provide financial documentation for program-related purchases.We will consider exceptional candidates who demonstrate a strong combination of the specific qualifications and skills described below.Comfort with public speaking and group facilitationAbility to inspire young people to get excited about food, and new experiences Excellent communication and organizational skillsExperience and/or strong interest in working with ethnically diverse teens and young adults from low income communities Experience in the food service industryCapacity to think and act intentionally and strategically to develop young people and help make positive shifts in attitudes and behaviorCommitment to addressing issues related to social justice, diversity, equity and inclusionDesire to be part of a diverse learning communityAbility to work collaboratively as part of a productive teamFlexibility and a positive, can-do attitudeRespect for the dignity of all work and willingness to consider multiple points of viewsPersonal and professional integrity to be a positive role model for young peopleAuthorization for employment in the USSpecial Job RequirementsValid driver’s license, good driving record and an ability to drive the company van; CORI check and driving record check required. ServSafe Managers Certification obtained within 2 months of hireTSNE MissionWorks/Future Chefs envisions a society grounded in the principles of social and economic justice. Job Posting DescriptionAt Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced through major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our acclaimed Neurology Team and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included.

We are looking for an experienced Clinical Research Manager to join the Neuromuscular Research Group in the Neurology Department of Boston Children’s Hospital.

The group is headed by Dr. Basil T. Darras, who specializes in molecular genetics and diagnostics of Duchenne and Becker muscular dystrophies, spinal muscular atrophy, and other myopathies, and on defining the indications for new diagnostic methodologies in the evaluation of children with pediatric neuromuscular diseases. His clinical focus is the care of children with neuromuscular conditions originating from inherited or acquired conditions of the motor unit. The Neuromuscular Group at BCH is a major site for clinical studies on spinal muscular atrophy and muscular dystrophy.

Minimum Education and Experience

Work requires the knowledge of theories, principles, and concepts acquired through completion of a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 8 years of relevant work experience or Master of Science and 4 yrs of relevant work experience.Applicants must have demonstrated ability in the following areas: Human Subjects Research Protections, working with the IRB, and FDA Regulatory requirements Working with Sponsors—industry, foundation, federal—to develop budgets, CTAs, and study startups Extensive Clinical Trials experience • Project Management Expertise Proven track record of managing and training staff in a research setting Additionally, applicants must be well-organized in order to manage multiple projects, responsibilities, and competing demands simultaneously. Working well on a team, as well as with other staff members, patients (children and families), providers, and departmental leadership is essential. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.

Nasuni is seeking an individual with a passion for analyzing complex software and creating test automation that ensures the quality of our best-in-class storage products. This person will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex automated tests including functional tests and large scale performance tests. Critical skills include familiarity with Python and Python testing frameworks (Pytest, Nosetest). The ideal candidate is a highly organized, self-motivated team player that is proficient in software development and testing.

Nasuni will hire and onboard remotely during Covid-19. After the virus, this position will be based in our Boston Seaport office.

Responsibilities

Participate in all aspects of the test cycle from gathering requirements to functional, system and regression testingDesign, execute and document detailed and thorough test plans and test cases to ensure product qualityAutomation of test cases and assist in the maintenance of the internal Python-based testing librariesEffectively isolate and analyze defects providing detailed steps and conditions for defect reproductionWork with developers to understand all aspects of defect resolution and verification

Qualification & Requirements

5+ years experience testing software: white & black box, functional, and system testing3-5+ years of professional Python software design and developmentKnowledge and experience with software testing best practices and methodologyAbility to design and write tests against dynamic resources such as external APIs and databases, mocking interfaces where neededExperience with version control systems, preferably GIT.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

Desired Skills

Understanding of file system concepts and protocols such as: networked filesystems, logical volumes, journaled filesystems, tiered storage, NFS, and CIFSDeep understanding of Linux and file systemsExcellent communicator, both written and verbal - able to independently and clearly communicate issues with othersPrior enterprise class storage product development experience a plusPrevious experience working in a dynamic and fast paced environment

About Nasuni

Nasuni delivers a single software platform to store, protect, synchronize, and collaborate on unstructured file data at scale. Nasuni Cloud File Services™, powered by the patented UniFS® global file system, leverages cloud storage to modernize primary NAS and file server storage; file archiving; backup; and disaster recovery, while offering transformational new capabilities for multi-site file collaboration. By combining the low cost, unlimited capacity, and durability of private or public cloud object storage with the high performance, security, and broad application compatibility of traditional disk-based file storage, the Nasuni subscription service improves workforce productivity, simplifies IT operations, and reduces IT costs. Nasuni operates globally from its worldwide headquarters in Boston, Mass., USA.

Why work at Nasuni?

As part of our commitment to your well-being, we are pleased to offer comprehensive benefits packages to employees across the world. Benefits packages vary by geography, but generally include:

Take-What-You-Need paid time offIncentive stock optionsComprehensive health, dental, and vision plansLife and disability insuranceRetirement planGenerous employee referral bonuses

To all recruitment agencies: Nasuni does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job boards, Nasuni employees or any other company location. Nasuni is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Under the general direction of the Administrative Manager in the Stem Cell Program, Boston Children’s Hospital, this position will work closely with designated Principal Investigators to manage the pre and post-award functions for federal, state, corporate, and private foundation sponsored funds, subcontracts, and/or projects supported by discretionary and endowment funds. Job Posting DescriptionThe Division of General Pediatrics at Boston Children's Hospital is seeking an enthusiastic, intelligent, and hardworking individual to work on grant-funded research within Dr. Landrigan’s research group. The group’s research focuses on developing, evaluating, and disseminating interventions to improve patient safety through structured communication, training, and teamwork using the Eisenberg award-winning I-PASS program (http://ipassstudygroup.com/) which has been published in the New England Journal, the British Medical Journal, and the Journal of the American Medical Association. The research assistant will provide project support for the I-PASS suite of projects (https://www.jointcommissionjournal.com/article/S1553-7250(17)30176-9/pdf). This includes projects to improve: (a) resident-physician communication at change of shift (I-PASS Resident Handoffs and CRICO Mentored Implementation of I-PASS, https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMsa1405556); (b) family-provider communication (Patient and Family Centered I-PASS, https://www.bmj.com/content/363/bmj.k4764); and (c) transitions of care at hospital discharge (Hospital to Home).

The Clinical Research Assistant II will be responsible for project support, data coordination, and keeping IRB documentation up-to-date. They will also support manuscript submissions, presentations, and other scholarship opportunities with the possibility of co-authorship. They may additionally assist with other related projects in the group.

This Clinical Research Assistant II will be responsible for:


Conducting literature searches and summarize findings.
Providing meeting support (e.g., tend to logistics, prepare materials, take minutes).
Assisting with ongoing data collection efforts (e.g., recruit participants, conduct surveys, abstract patient charts, obtain hospital administrative data).
Conducting preliminary quantitative (e.g., claims, survey) and/or qualitative (e.g., interview) analyses.
Supporting clinical research reporting for data review, quality control checks, and interim and final analysis.
Providing data coordination and data management services.
Filing human subjects review board protocols and amendments.
Aggregating data and aid in data cleaning and management.
Preparing graphs, charts and other visuals.
Supporting the writing of abstracts, poster presentations and research articles.
Assisting with grant writing, preparation and submissions.
Other duties as needed.


To qualify, you must have:


A Bachelor’s degree in science, math, psychology or related fields and a minimum of one year of relevant work experience. A Master’s degree in public health or epidemiology preferred but not required.
Interest in patient safety, quality improvement, transitions of care, communication, or family-centered care.
Analytical skills to gather and interpret data in an organized, accurate and timely manner.
High proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel (including Pivot Tables), and PowerPoint required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strong self-motivation, teamwork, and interpersonal skills and be proactive, organized, and attentive to detail.
The ability to prioritize assignments and become familiar with new topics quickly.
Outstanding candidates will possess the above skills and can commit to a 2-year position.
Prior experience in quality improvement, redcap, recruiting subjects, data analysis would be of benefit.

Rubius Therapeutics is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing a new class of medicines called Red Cell Therapeutics™. Our proprietary RED PLATFORM® was designed to genetically engineer and culture Red Cell Therapeutics™ that are selective, potent and off-the-shelf allogeneic cellular therapies for the potential treatment of several diseases across multiple therapeutic areas. Our therapies can potentially be used to kill tumors in cancer and to regulate the immune system for the treatment of autoimmune diseases. Our IND for RTX-240, our first oncology candidate for the treatment of solid tumors, has been cleared by the FDA. Additionally, we plan to file an IND for RTX-321 for the treatment of HPV-positive tumors by year-end.We are proud of our passionate, high-performance culture – one based on a set of values that are the cornerstone of who we are and how we hold ourselves accountable. Founded in 2013, we are based in Cambridge, MA and currently expanding across all functions within the organization. Red blood cells are no longer just for carrying oxygen. Check us out at www.rubiustx.com, or follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn or like us on Facebook.
Summary
We are looking for a Principal Engineer to join the Cell Therapy Process Development (CPD) team. The role is multi-faceted - as this key scientific leader will help drive the effort for establishing both technology (in particular cell culture media as an industrial upstream platform approach) and lead pipeline projects for the process development team. They will manage a team of scientists to optimize, scale-up, and characterize the novel cell therapy platform. The leader and their team will collaborate with partner groups including Manufacturing, Bioanalytical and Formulation Development, and Gene Delivery to facilitate rapid process development cycles.The ideal candidate will have direct, hands-on industrial upstream experience (ideally in gene and/or cell therapy process development), along with a strong understanding of the principles of cell culture medium development (demonstrated success in media development will be ideal). This candidate must be a strong technical leader in order to contribute actively to both technology and the pipeline projects directly. Responsibilities





Design and develop upstream process development experiments.Oversight of cell culture medium optimization, process development projects and people management responsibilities while maintaining a direct, active presence in the lab.Oversight of process development for a portfolio project Contribute to technical vision and development of the RCT technology as part of the CPD teamDocument and communicate results in a timely manner.Manage various priorities in a fast-paced and changing environment. Present and communicate progress of technology and project activities at internal and external meetings, as appropriate



Qualifications & Education





Ph.D. and 5+ years or MS and 8+ years of experience in bioengineering, chemical engineering, biology, biochemistry or related field with prior stem cell differentiation experience a plus.Strong industrial upstream processing knowledge required Industrial experience with biologics, gene and/or cell therapy upstream process development including ownership of key process decisions.Understanding of the data package, reports, etc. required to advance processes into clinical manufacturing desired.Motivated, curious, and comfortable working with highly technical projects and personnel.Comfortable delivering against challenging commitments.Direct prior industrial experience managing at least 1-2 direct reports desired.Experience with matrix management of personnel on projects or management of temporary personnel is a must.

jobDetails:
The Estimator / Planner role carries responsibility for successful completion of the preconstruction cost forecasting and planning of a project in preparation for the build phase. Objective is to provide the optimum assessment for the overall assignment including all trade scopes of work and project related impacts. The estimator is supported by specialists in civil and MEP,FP systems and is expected to have a working knowledge of these systems. The Estimator / Planner will analyze and coordinate both documented and conceptualized documentation in order to develop a comprehensive trade / bid package study. The Estimator / Planner will assess scheduling impacts and lead time influences in order to support development of the master project schedule. The Estimator / Planner works closely with the Owner, Architect, Project Executive, Purchasing Agent and other team members employing collaborative project planning, cost savings and value analysis techniques as well as coordinating subcontractors in advance of field operations and acts as a resource throughout a projects lifecycle.

Requirements

  Develop estimated quantity and cost assessment of all project components from early conceptual development through final construction documentation Analyze project documents, specifications, subcontractor proposals and other project data in order to prepare comprehensive cost estimates for project pursuit and construction phase. Manage constructability review, initiate design recommendations and participate in constructability assessment relative to project efficiency and completeness of project documentation. Work closely with Civil, MEP / FP Estimators, Project Executive, Project Managers, Superintendent and other members of project team to analyze and resolve project details and capture appropriate cost impacts for all project aspects. Analyze scheduling impacts and lead time influences in order to support development of the master project schedule.  Evaluate and assess cost and schedule impacts of project jurisdictional permitting and approval efforts Perform evaluation and cost assessment of construction management logistics, temporary requirements and site control requirements. Apply knowledge of specialized methodologies, techniques, principles and processes in order to develop, assemble and present completed estimate forecast to project stakeholders. Pre-qualify subcontractors and enhance subcontracting database pool Determine and document final scope of work and make recommendations as to appropriate subcontractor pricing Coordinate and compare subcontractor bids to ensure leveling of pricing comparisons. Knowledge of local market pricing for labor, material, and equipment used in commercial construction on a variety of brownfield and greenfield site conditions Candidate should be a detailed and thorough individual able to manage a large volume of project assignments that range in size from $10 million to $300 million in value

Qualifications:

 BS Degree in Engineering, Construction Management or equivalent Construction Management experience 3- 5 years’ industry experience preferred Strong communication, leadership and team building skills MS Office skills required, including Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint Timberline estimating platform experience preferred Model based estimating platform experience preferred USGBC LEED implementation experience and certification preferred PHIUS / Passive House experience preferred Knowledge of prefabrication techniques and Lean implementation is preferred

DIMEO CONSTRUCTION COMPANY IS AN AFFIRMATIVE ACTION/EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Benefits

Competitive compensation package and benefits.

Are you passionate about creating a diverse, thriving community for social and environmental innovators, entrepreneurs, funders, and activists? Join us to support our Boston community in driving tangible solutions to the world’s most pressing issues.
Impact Hub Boston seeks an established business and cultural leader with deep networks, who has demonstrably increased revenues, social impact, and member/staff satisfaction, to skillfully build on our strong capabilities as our next Director.

ABOUT THIS ROLEThis role is for a pragmatic leader with strong entrepreneurial skills to help Impact Hub Boston to create additional tangible impact for our local communities while growing revenues and profitability. You will be in charge of executing both long-term strategy and day-to-day management and operation of Impact Hub Boston.

ABOUT IMPACT HUB BOSTONImpact Hub Boston is a community and place that pursues a more just and sustainable world where business and profit are used in service of people and planet. We inspire, connect, and enable people and organizations to fuel entrepreneurial action.
Everyone has ideas to make the world a better place; we turn ideas into action and intention into impact. We provide access to a supportive community with resources, connections, knowledge, talent, and investments. We create places and opportunities for purpose-driven people to connect and build solutions for a better world. 
Impact Hub Boston is part of a global network of over 100 Impact Hubs across the globe, representing more than 50 countries and 17,000+ ‘change-maker’ members. Impact Hub Boston is currently housed within the Boston campus of CIC (a sister organization to Impact Hub Boston) with co-working space, private offices, and event space in the heart of downtown Boston.

GENERAL OVERVIEW OF RESPONSIBILITIESThis role has historically driven the work of making Impact Hub Boston the place where people engaged in social impact work come together to learn from, connect to, and gain inspiration from each other. This role has supported the entire Impact Hub Boston community, working within the larger framework of the global Impact Hub network (through connecting with other individual sites, the North America regional cluster, and with the global network). 
The successful applicant for this role brings with them the passion, capabilities, and track record needed to expand Impact Hub Boston’s impact in a new direction, building upon the unique strengths and attributes of this world-class community of innovators.
The Director will report to the Board of Impact Hub Boston, and currently has four direct full-time reports as well as managing contractor relationships that support finance, billing, and other temporary/periodic functions.

The general responsibilities of the Director fall into four themes:
Strategy & Leadership• Inspire our team to deliver exceptional service, drive financial success within existing and a new line of business, and work with the Board of Directors to set and manage the strategic plan,• Lead strategic initiatives, measuring performance and impact with an eye toward mitigating and managing potential business risks and vulnerabilities,• Sustain a positive, inspiring, and culturally competent work culture, supporting growth and professional development of four full-time employees and 25 volunteers + contract staff,• Build and maintain relationships with partners in delivering innovative, impactful solutions to important problems and support the work of social innovators in the Boston region,• Represent Impact Hub Boston to all stakeholders, including at outside events and speaking engagements, enhancing our public recognition and visibility. 
Operations• Provide day-to-day team management, set and monitor team KPIs and goals, and manage hiring and on-boarding of new employees,• Manage company-wide projects through all phases of development, improve existing processes and investigate improvement opportunities that use iterative planning, coordination, and automation,• Oversee member relations, manage and extend our partnership with CIC and building management, and monitor vendor relationships,• Ensure Impact Hub Boston is inviting to members of all backgrounds, oversee high-quality programming for all members, market to diverse audiences.
Finances• Manage and grow existing P&L (member growth and event revenue), prove out a new revenue opportunity, and raise capital as needed to grow the organization,• Make the case for additional investment in growth strategies to the Board of Directors and external investors, as appropriate,• Determine how to reinvest profits wisely to maximize opportunities for sustained support of our mission over time, with the assistance of the board,• Create and track annual budgets, regularly and transparently reporting to the board and staff, and analyze monthly cash flow/spending reports,• Develop a sales plan and execute marketing campaigns to continue building our local brand.
Impact• Increase members’ impact through various means, including telling our members’ stories, developing strategic partnerships, and supporting marketing, networking and sales opportunities; establish an impact advisory board,• Strengthen our engagement with important social issues in Greater Boston,• Set and measure inclusion as an important staff goal,• Report annually on our impact, by global Impact Hub survey data and B Lab Impact Assessment metrics, and report quarterly to our board.

REQUIREMENTS• Passion for our mission to inspire, connect, and enable people and organizations to fuel entrepreneurial action for a better world,• 7+ years of work experience; 4+ years of experience in a senior role and management position with 3+ direct reports,• A thorough understanding of financial management and management principles and techniques, including 2+ years managing a P&L demonstrating significant growth, and a record of success in managing budgets,• Proven experience with business scaling; enthusiasm for strategic planning, growth, and expansion, and demonstrated facility with entrepreneurial thinking in a complex environment,• Knowledgeable and passionate about Boston’s (or of a comparable urban area’s) diverse communities and neighborhoods, and the local challenges and issues that face those communities.

IDEAL CANDIDATE• Has an unwavering commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and a strong affinity with and dedication to our mission and values of community, inclusivity, justice, authenticity, and courage,• Believes in team and community as sources of strength; can coach and develop staff, nurture a strong community, and engender deep belief in a shared vision,• Wants to build a business that is a force for good, and is excited about enriching how we operate: with our governance, staff, environmental impact, and our impact on our customers and community,• Inspires others to enact their vision of a more just and sustainable world, using business and profit in service of people and the planet,• Brings knowledge and experience of the social enterprise sector and a high level understanding of sector trends and opportunities,• Is invigorated by the ability and opportunity to innovate, comfortable with ambiguity and can move forward in the midst of changing circumstances, rally various stakeholders in supporting Impact Hub efforts and oversee effective execution,• Has a strong appetite for networking, relationship building, and public speaking,• Wants to grow the organization (and its impact), and grow with the organization, for the next 5+ years.

COMPENSATION AND TIME EXPECTATIONSThis is a full-time salaried position with some material flexible hours around evening and occasional weekend work. Compensation of $120k, plus 100% of the cost of a premium healthcare and dental package, long and short-term disability, life insurance, 401k with partial match up to 5%, and three weeks vacation from the start (more with seniority).

ATTRACTIONS OF WORKING AT IMPACT HUB BOSTON• The opportunity to lead in the development of new approaches to solving problems that matter.• What does our staff love most about working here? Their colleagues!• The 300+ members at Impact Hub Boston are sharp, diverse, and motivated to create a better future for Boston, the US, and the world, and take part in a wide range of industries in a dynamic environment of constant learning.• Highly varied, entrepreneurial work that requires inspired vision: each day brings opportunities to bring creative solutions for a better business and positive impact.• Impact Hub Boston is centrally located to the Blue, Green, Orange, Red, and Silver MBTA lines, as well as major highways and both train stations.• Fantastic additional benefits such as unlimited access to a well-stocked kitchen (ask us about our tea wall), monthly massage at no cost, an onsite wellness program, flexible working space, and a host of discounts towards local business and well-being memberships.

Equal Opportunity Employer Impact Hub Boston is an equal opportunity employer and places a high value on workforce diversity. We strongly encourage applications from current residents of greater Boston, women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, individuals with disabilities, and veterans. Impact Hub policy prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, gender, religion, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.

OverviewTHIS IS A TEMPORARY, GRANT-FUNDED POSITION.

This is a provisional appointment.

Brief Job Description (essential functions of the job):

Under general supervision, serves as chief of a field survey party with responsibility for the performance of field surveys of ordinary/professional difficulty and performs a wide variety of other beginning level professional civil engineering work in the field and the office. Responsibilities




 Supervises a field party engaged in preliminary and final surveys on construction work.
Runs surveys prior to construction in order to identify and locate surface objects within traverse.
Computes area quantities from recorded field notes; checks areas on plot plans.
Plots cross-sections and computes areas and volume of earth moved in street excavations.
Draws preliminary plans and estimates the cost of construction for a minor project.
Makes property surveys and topographic surveys of lands used for various municipal purposes.
Stakes outlines and grades for the construction of streets.
Performs related work as required. 

Required to work any emergency as directed by the Chief of Streets or designee. Minimum Entrance Qualifications




 Applicants must have at least two (2) years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, technical or professional experience in Civil Engineering work in such areas as construction, survey, design, transportation, hydraulics, structural, sanitary, drafting, environmental, highway, architectural, airport, soils and materials or any equivalent combination of the required experience and the educational substitutions. 

Ability to exercise good judgment and focus on detail as required by the job.
Applicants must have and maintain a current Massachusetts Driver's License.

OverviewTHIS IS A TEMPORARY POSITION FOR APPROXIMATELY 10 MONTHS WITH POSSIBILITY TO RENEW.

EMPLOYMENT IN THIS POSITION WILL BE VIA AN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT.

Brief Job Description (essential functions of the job):

The Boston Transportation Department (BTD) is seeking candidates for its Active Transportation community programs team. Team members support multiple education and outreach initiatives, with most of their time dedicated to on-bike youth and adult educational programming across the City. ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

Under the supervision of the Active Transportation Director,



 Instruct bicycle skills, the parts of a bicycle, flat-repair, and bicycle safety rules to students ranging from elementary school children to older adults.
Lead group rides and on-bicycle skill-building activities, keeping the class organized and safe.
Select bicycle routes and assess risk.
Transport bicycles and helmets to/from sites, sometimes hundreds in a day.
Assist in maintaining fleet of bicycles and supplies.
Organize and execute events, under direction of an Active Transportation Coordinator.
Engage and educate the public about BTD projects, initiatives, and other transportation safety topics.
Remove and transport abandoned bicycles from the public right-of-way.
Respond to constituent requests, questions, and complaints.
Perform related work as required.


 Minimum Entrance Qualifications




 Experience teaching youth of varied ages.
Value working with diversity of people and team teaching methods.
Enjoy riding a bicycle and be able to ride for work.
Reliable, punctual, and strong work ethic.
Positive, professional attitude and capacity to adapt quickly in response to circumstances.
Proficiency in other languages, such as Spanish, Chinese, Vietnamese, Portuguese, Haitian-Creole, and Arabic, is beneficial but not required.
Bicycle maintenance and mechanic skills beneficial, but not required.
Valid driver’s license with good driving record preferred, but not required.
Ability to exercise good judgment and focus on detail as required by the job.

Pay & Terms:



 $14-$16 per hour, commensurate with experience.
Benefits not included.
10-month Employment Agreement with possibility to renew.
10-35 hours/week, with more hours April-June and September-October.
Summer, weekend, evening, and other opportunities are offered on an as-needed basis.
Boston Residency Required.
